body:
Coping | Part 2


——

*knock knock knock*

“Brother are you okay?”

“Kip please leave me alone, I’m dealing with some stuff.” I attempt to say, but I’m just so hoarse. I cried all of last night am now, I’m just laying here.

“Is this because you and Amber broke up?” A tear rolled down my cheek.

Amber was the cause for this, Amber is the reason I have this big hole in my heart. The reason multiple people are hurt. And the reason my school hates me.

“Jonah?”

I storm over to and sling it open. I don’t care if Kip is just a kid, she should learn not to annoy people. She should know that if someone says to leave them alone, they should do it!

“KIP, I SAID LEAVE! WHY ARE YOU STILL HERE! I WANT TO BE ALONE AND ALL YOU DO IS BUG ME! HONESTLY WHY ARE YOU SO ANNOYING!?!”

Her eyes fill with tears and her lip pokes out. I instantly knew I messed up. I’m not mad at her. But I have this rage in my stomach and nowhere to put it.

I hug her and her arms wrap around my waist. As she sobs she apologizes. I feel like the biggest jerk in the universe. She is the best sister a guy could have and I hurt her.

I crouch down so I can meet her eyes. The sweet caramel color matched my mothers. I sadly am cursed with my father’s eyes.

“I am so sorry. I love you so much. Your brother is just dealing with some mean kids right now. When I get sad though, I yell and scream, ok? It’s not that you did anything, it’s me. I am working on it.”

She wiped her eyes and thought about what I said.

“I’m sorry the people are being mean to you. I think your the best person in the world. I love you brother, and I want to help.”

“You just did. Also, was there something you needed.”

“Oh yeah! I almost forgot, your friend is here! He REALLY wants to see you.” I gulped.

He? That could be one of two people and I don’t want to see either of them.

Cyrus, probably wants to talk. I upset him yesterday and the last thing I need is to recap yesterday.

And Walker, he is probably here to yell at me. We ended things as well as we could but, he could easily blame me for what’s happening. Even if I didn’t place the picture there, I was the one who got caught kissing him.

As I approached the door I was startled, TJ Kippen was standing at the door. He was someone I never expect to see. He is always in his room when I was at Ambers. So. for him to be here is kinda…

Nerve racking?

“Hey man!” He smiles as I enter the doorway. I give him an awkward bro hug and it just got more confusing.

“Hey, what are you doing here?”

His smile drops, “Actually I’m here to talk. Is there somewhere we can go?”

“Um, yeah my rooms in the very back to the left.”

As we walked down the hall my mind spiraled just trying to process what was happening, why was he here?

To yell?

To blame me?

To hurt me?

Definitely not to listen. I did JUST break up with his sister.

He walks into my room. He sees the baseball I have laying on the floor, he picks it up. He sits on my bed and starts tossing it back and forth in his hands.

Left

Right

Left

Right

The pace the ball was going was relaxing to me I was able to steady my breathing to the speed of the ball.

In

Out

In

Out

The stress inside my head minimized. I looked away from the ball and pulled a rolly-chair up to my bed. I looked up and met his eyes. The air grew awkward as we sat in silence, I noticed he wasn’t looking at me. Rather, he was staring at the ball. Almost like his life depended on it. I coughed to make some attempt of getting his attention. His eyes slowly drifted to mine and he opened his mouth to say something but shut it before anything came out. Almost like he was ashamed.

“TJ, I don’t mind you being here but if your here to scream at me can we go ahead and get it over with. I get you think I’m this monster, but I did nothing to Amber. She was aware of my situation and she fully accepted it. That picture was taken before I even started dating Amber. So, if your going to do something do it.” I say this while being shocked by my confidence. I never have stood up to anyone but this is the time I did.

I stood up and spread my arms out. I was hoping this would make the whole beating up process easier. As I stand there I hear him laugh.

Laugh?

Why is he laughing?

He should be punching, or kicking, or something??

He looks at me and he says “Bro, you more chill then I thought. Obviously we’re cool. Amber knew the relationship was over way before this, she actually wanted to come and apologize for her, since she knew you probably didn’t want to see her.”

“Oh” I mutter. As I hear my subconscious scream at me how stupid I am. Of course that’s why he’s here. He wouldn’t just stumble here on his own.

“I actually was going to come talk to you even if she didn’t force me down here.”

“Why? No offense to you though, I mean we just haven’t talked before and with recent events you probably I didn’t think you would want to see me anyway. I know I should have probably stopped by your room and said hi before. It’s just that the school kinda makes you out to be this monster. NOT THAT YOU ARE A MONSTER. I was just saying the school thinks that, when it’s totally not true. Also I’ve rambling haven’t I? Wow most people can’t get three words out of me but I am going on and on and on. I’m stopping… Now.”

“I take back my chill statement from before.” He smiles. “Also I get that this is weird, me being here and all. I just wanted to make sure you were ok.”

“Yeah, I’m fine” I say in a completely monotone manor.

“Look you don’t have to lie, I get what your going through.”

He rest my hand on my shoulder. I remove it immediately not wanting to seem rude, I just don’t like being touched. It makes me feel awkward, and I know he doesn’t mean anything by it. I just can’t focus on anything other than his hand on me, if his hands on me.

I realize I’m focused on the wrong thing and redirect my attention to the conversation in front of me.

Him?

He has the perfect life. He wouldn’t know what I’m going through AT ALL! In fact, that couldn’t be farther from the truth! What he said definitely rubbed me the wrong way, and I’m going to let him know it!

“You, what on EARTH would you know about what I’m going through.” I feel a tear form in my eye. “I HAVE NO ONE! NO ONE UNDERSTANDS! ESPECIALLY NOT YOU! MR.BASKETBALL MAN! THAT’S ALL YOU ARE, TJ KIPPEN, THE GUY WHO CAN HAVE ANYONE, ANYTIME HE WANTS!”

He looks me in the eyes, “ I was going to be civil Jonah, but screw it.” He says in the deepest, most intimidating voice I’ve ever heard.

“POOR LITTLE JONAH! HE’S SO ALONE! HE ONLY HAS HIS FAMILY AND FRIENDS BY HIS SIDE! POOR LITTLE JONAH! GOT HIS FEELINGS HURT! LET’S ALL FORGET THE FACT THAT I WAS OUTED TO THE WHOLE BASKETBALL TEAM! THAT I LOST THE MAJORITY OF MY FRIENDS! THAT I LOST THE PERSON I LOVED BECAUSE HE WASN’T READY! LET’S ALL FOCUS ON JONAH FLIPPING BECK! NO ONE NEEDS A TJ KIPPEN IN THERE LIFE!” He explodes.

I just stare at him for a second, TJ is gay.

TJ lost people.

TJ is hurt.

TJ came here to feel less alone.

And I once again stepped all over this great person.

What is WRONG with me!

“I-I’m sorry man, I had no idea.”

“It’s good, I paid off the team not to tell anyone. I can’t even imagine having this happen to me. Kids are tough.” He chuckles

“You can say that again.”

He smirks, we sit there for a minute, letting the previous conversation soak in. A lot did happen very fast.

After a minute he gets this look on his face, kinda like he has an idea. He stands up and he says, “We’re gonna do it.”

“Woah man, we’re cool and all but—“

“NO! God no! You are DEFINITELY NOT my type.”

“Then, what did you mean?”

“I MEANT we’re going to go talk to them”

“Oh…” I say slightly confused. Who did he mean by them? He must of picked up on the not so subtle clues that I had no idea what he meant because he explained further.

“YOUR going to talk to picture boy, and I’M going to talk to my once in a million.”

“OH! I get—, picture boy? You don’t know who it is?”

“No man, the picture was taken at a weird angle. You can only make out who you are, don’t you check your phone? Who is picture boy is trending.”

“What? no, No, NO! This can’t- can’t be happening.”

I lose my perception what reality as my head spins. I can’t breathe and feel myself slide to the floor. I feel like I’m dying as the world gets smaller around me. I can only think of how mad Walkers going to be when he looks at his phone. I feel myself claw into the rug I next to my bed. “Help!” I make out hoping that someone will hear. I start to slowly hear my Mom’s voice, she tells me that I’m having a panic attack and that it will end. It doesn’t feel like it, but I do slowly feel the air go into my lungs again. I try to focus on that until I get back to where I can recognize what’s happening. TJ is standing at the doorway and my mom has me enveloped in a hug. I am back to being ok.

My mom knows this and stands up. This has so many times now she doesn’t even ask questions, she just leaves.

TJ runs over to me. “Are you ok?”

“Yeah, and I’m ready. Let’s go talk to them.”

“Sweet?” He says.”But first can you explain what just happened?”

“Doesn’t matter it’s all over now.” I want him to believe me because I have anxiety and that was a panic attack. Isn’t a conversation I want to have with a total stranger.

“Right…”

“Plus right now I need to go see Wa—. Er, I mean Picture Boy and you need to see…” I feel myself tense up. I almost said Walker, that would not be good. He could be lying about everything.

“Actually, about that. Let’s not go, my ex and I didn’t end on great terms. I mean we were perfect when we were together, but we both did dumb things. We went from being with each other everyday, to fighting once a week, to a slight ‘hey, how are you?’ in the hallway, to nothing at all.” He admitted

“There’s no guy is there? I mean, you obviously can’t make up a name so I’ll do it for you. Steve Earle! There’s a name. Joseph Maccoby. There’s another! Look, I GOT A LOT TO DEAL WITH AND IF YOUR JUST HERE TO GET INFORMATION ABOUT ME THEN LEAVE! TELL AMBER YOU APOLOGIZED AND JUST L—“

“Marty.” He muttered

“What?”

“MARTY, that’s my ex! You know Marty, your friend Marty, Marty from the party, Marty the ‘basketball man’, Marty who has been with me through EVERYTHING!”

“Marty?”

“Yup” He said, popping the p.

“I’m sorry… again. I just know with the ‘Picture Boy’ craze that’s going on, it’s just hard to trust someone.”

“I get that” he laughed. “You want to go do something?”

“Actually I do need to go talk to, you know..”

“Yeah ok, I’ll go then.”

“Bye TJ”

He exits my room. I’m left to progress what just happened. TJ just talked to me. TJ is gay and dated Marty. Is Marty gay? He seems so close to Buffy. Is there a way to like both? Ugh it’s too confusing.

Back to that Picture Boy thing, was that real? I grabbed my phone and power it on. I cut it off last night because of all of the spamming. I go to Twitter and see that, sure enough, you don’t see Walker very well in the picture. People are trying to guess who it is. I laugh at some that are obviously jokes, I mean I couldn’t see some of them with me in a million years. There were none that even pointed toward Walker as a suspect. Still, I probably do need to talk to him.

I went to my contacts and scrolled and finally landed on his name.

Me: Hello Mr. Picture Boy

Deleted

Me: Been awhile…

Deleted

Me: So how are you?

Deleted

Me: I’m coming over.

Sent

I decided I would have to do this in person, I don’t like talking on the phone, and you can overthink while texting. I need to see him, talk to him, and hear him.

I go over to my closet and try to decide which outfit goes with “Sorry I almost outed you and I hope we can still be friends.” God this is a disaster. Just like me I guess. A disaster. I’m just like a hurricane, I leave a mess everywhere I go and I leave people hurt with no turning back.

I finally decide on my gray shirt Amber bought me for my birthday. I’m not gonna lie it is super comfortable. She did always know what I want, but what she’s done is unforgivable. After I get back from Walkers I fully plan to bury myself under a pound of blankets and cry until the sweet release of death.

I go down street and started counting, when we were together I figured out it took exactly 230 steps to get to his house. So, it became a habit to count on the way there.

As I reached the 200s my heart began to pound. I was not prepared for what I was throwing myself into.

210. Almost there.

220. I’m right next to his house.

230. I’m there.

I knocked on his door. “Here we go.” I whispered under my breath.

The door opens to reveal his beautiful mother, wearing another outfit Walker designed. His parents are so supportive of his dreams of being a designer, when my dad was around the only option for me was the army. Secretly though, I would try to learn guitar. I borrowed one from Gus’s dad from time to time. I feel like if I had a good teacher, I might be able to go somewhere. Not that my mom could afford it. So I guess for now no dreams is what I can manage.

“Jonah! Sweetheart, it’s been too long, how are you?” She says as she hugs me.

“Hey Violet, I’m great.” I say a little too enthusiastically. “I love the dress is it new?”

“Yep, Walk just made it last week.”

“Well it suits you. Speaking of Walk, is he home?”

She sighs,”Yeah but he’s in a mood, won’t let anyone in.”

“Can I give it a go?”

“Sure, but say hi to Marcus on the way. We both have really missed you.”

“I’ve missed you guys too. Life just gets in the way sometimes.” I laugh nervously, obviously they don’t know what happened between us. I’m not going to be the one to tell them that their son and I are in some deep trouble right now.

“Well, I get that.” She laughs.

I decide that’s my time to leave. I run across the house, straight to Walker’s door. I took a deep breath to prepare for the storm of hate and rage that was about to hit me.

*Knock Knock Knock*

“GO AWAY DAD! I DON’T WANT TO TALK ABOUT GIRLS ANYMORE!”

Dang he is mad.

“Hot Fudge Sundae” I whispered. We came up with the code right after our first date. It lets us know that it’s each other. My code is hot fudge sundae, and his is painted smiles.

“Jonah?”

“Yeah it’s me. Can I come in?”

“Yes just don’t let anyone follow you.”

I slowly opened the door, I saw him wrapped in a blanket. He had puffy eyes that matched mine. He obviously didn’t need to be informed on what had happened.

“Are you ok?” I asked. I already knew the answer but I didn’t know how else to start this conversation.

“I should be asking you that.” He said.

He honestly has never sounded worse. I climbed up beside him in the bed and he laid his head on my shoulder. Just like in the good old days.

“Are you mad at me?”

“No.”

“I figured you would be, having been a victim of my locker and all”

He half smiled “I wouldn’t think you put it there yourself, heck, you didn’t know what to identify as a month ago. Did you ever figure that out?”

“Nope, all I know is I’m a little more confused everyday. And you, did you ever pick a label?”

“Right now, I like pansexual. I feel like it describes me pretty well.”

“That’s great… What exactly is that?”

He laughed a little “I pretty much fall for someone’s personality rather than their gender. I do have a slight preference to males, but I’m open to any gender.”

“Oh, I didn’t know that existed. Your right though, it does suit you.”

He smiles at me, and I smiled back. I’m happy for Walk, it must be comforting to know what you are.

“Hey? We’re going to be ok, right? Like, this will end eventually?” I asked

“I honestly don’t know Jo, I wish I could tell you yes, but kids are so… What’s the word?”

“Cruel, hateful, clueless, closed-minded?”

“Yeah…” He says looking away.

We sat there in this silence for awhile. We used to do this for hours, just be with each other. I missed it so much. I don’t like him anymore but I do need him, as my best friend right now. He gets it, what I’m going through, how hard it’s been, how lonely it is.

All of it.

It’s easy to rely on the ones you trust. Which why it’s different then someone like TJ or Cyrus. Sure, they seem nice but I don’t trust them yet. As I grew deeper into my thinking, I felt Walker grab my hand.

I pulled away.

“Don’t” I mumble verily loud enough to hear.

He turn to look at me. “Why?”

“I can’t do this again, Walk, I know times are tough right now. I mean that, but if we go back to how we were we’ll get hurt again. I loved you, and I still do. I just know that we both aren’t mentally stable enough to be together. Not yet.”

He sat up and moved to the foot of his bed to face me. “I know, I’ve just missed you so much. I won’t do it again, I promise, just don’t—“

“Just don’t what?”

“Just don’t leave again. I can handle being friends, and just to let you know I’ve started therapy. I got antidepressants, they work, for the most part. Some days are still tough though. Like today, the locker thing hit me hard, not gonna lie. Then, my dad came up here, and when refused to open the door, he was convinced it because of some girl. It just reminded me that I’m still not as open, or out, as I want to be. It hurts so much Jonah. I used to talk to you about this stuff, then you quit coming around. I get that though. I’ve just been so alone.” He cried.

I pulled him into a hug and after a couple minutes I pulled away.

“I know I left. That’s why I didn’t want you close. I push those people away, especially when they need me. I get scared then, I hurt them. We both fell victim though, it hurt so much to leave you. I forced myself not to return, I knew we pulling each other down, instead of lifting each other up. I wasn’t going to let that happen. We agreed on that. I am here when you need me though. I might not be much help but I will listen.” I said trying to defend myself.

He sat there a second, looking at the stars on his ceiling. Then after about two minutes of saying nothing, he got up and went to his closet, he came back with face paint and brushes.

“I hope you don’t mind but it’s getting kind of serious and I think we both could use a little light heartedness.”

“I’d love that.” I grinned.

We both started grabbing colors and brushes. Then I went first. He wanted something goofy, something to make him laugh. So I did the best thing possible, which was turn his head into a giant cheeseburger. As I started on the bun I began to attempt to catch up on what’s been going on.

“I liked your Mom’s new dress. It had a lot more detail in it then the ones she wore when I was last around.”

He looked amused. “Yeah, took a couple classes and picked up some new techniques.”

“Well they look great.”

“I might need to change them then.”

“Why?”

“No offense, but you have no taste sweetie.” He joked

“Shut up!”

“Will not.”

Within no time were busting out laughing at old memories and inside jokes. It honestly felt so good to be back. It made me happier than I had been in awhile.

“You remember the time we tried to do a piggyback race with your sister and Kaylee?”

“Yeah, we ended up just falling over because SOMEONE said I was too heavy.”

“WELL I NEVER SAID I WAS AN ATHLETE!”

I missed joking around with him he was my best friend, I’m so glad I got him back. I mean he was my BEST friend, even before we dated. He would come over to my house all the time, my mom called him her adopted son.

“So how’s Laura aka my mom?”

“My moms as good as she can be.” I laughed

“So? Still utterly clueless?”

“At this point I could write depressed on my head, kiss a guy, and have a panic attack right in front of her, and she still wouldn’t know what was going on.”

“Please, at least she isn’t always in your business. I’m surprised I’m still closeted after all the ‘girl talks’ my dad has had with me.”

“Yikes.”

“Yeah, he’s gonna be so disappointed when he finds out. I’m not even that worried about my mom. She’s so loving that it literally wouldn’t change anything.”

“At least your mom and dad are still here.” I wasn’t thinking when I said that. The room fell to a hush. We sat there in silence as I finished the last few designs.

“…and done” I say after finishing my master piece.

He went over to the mirror and instantly fell over from laughing.

“Nice one Ronald McDonald.” He mocks.

“Like you’ll do any better.” I say, knowing very well his will be a trillion times better.

He begins his with a dark brown and continues our conversation.

“So when do you think you’ll go back to school.”

“Probably around… um… never. Never sounds good.”

“C’mon, it can’t be that bad” he says.

I take out my phone and read him a few of the hundreds of mean comments, texts, voicemails, emails, and tweets, I had been sent.

“Dang that’s tough. How are you staying so strong?” He asked

“Well for the most part my phone is turned off, but occasionally I go on to see who they think you are.”

“Oh I do the same thing! I mean I knew about the hate, but I swear I think they have named everyone except me by now. I don’t know if I should offended or relieved.”

“Relieved, definitely relieved.”

“Good to know, and just to let you know, I don’t regret anything that happened. Sure, I do wish I wasn’t trending with the anonymous ‘Picture Boy’ name, but I wouldn’t take back that kiss.”

“Me either.” I say looking directly in his eyes.

“Friends?” He asked like I was going to reject the offer.

“Friends.” I beamed.

He did a few more touch ups. I could tell because he was super focused and his tongue was sticking out.

“Your done” he exclaimed. I walk over to the mirror and started laughing at the monkey that was now on my face. It was definitely not what I expected. He usually does more detailed designs but this was simple. I really liked it.

As I was sitting back down I glanced up at the clock and noticed how late it had gotten.

“I’m going to take off, it was good seeing you again.”

“Same here.”

I rushed out his house, first stopping to say goodbye to Marcus and Violet. With the monkey still on my face, I sprinted home, just making it by my curfew. As I walked in my mom started laughing.

“You go to Walkers today?”

“Yup” I said as I slowly walked to my room.

“Good I like that kid.”

“I WANT A MONKEY!” Kip chimed in.

Gosh I love that child. I hope she never goes through what I am. I go over and ruffle her hair. She gives a look of shock.

Kip then jumps, landing on me. I tried to hold her up but we both end up in the floor. I begin laughing, hard. She jumps up and runs away screaming, giggles slipping through when she catches her breath. She’s adorable.

I roll over and look up my mom, she had my phone in her hand.

“I’m sorry, i-it was buzzing and I just-“ she stutters.

I half smile, of course this happens. Right when I start to feel better, this stuff happens. It’s almost amusing how my life can’t just be right, not even for a little bit.

I laugh, not a regular laugh. No, it’s deep, bitter, and cold. I’m done with this, not just this, everything.

“Nope” I say as I storm to my room. So much for a good day.

——

Her eyes fill with tears and her lip pokes out. I instantly knew I messed up. I’m not mad at her. But I have this rage in my stomach and nowhere to put it.

I hug her and her arms wrap around my waist. As she sobs she apologizes. I feel like the biggest jerk in the universe. She is the best sister a guy could have and I hurt her.

“I am so sorry. I love you so much. Your brother is just dealing with some mean kids right now. When I get sad though, I yell and scream, ok? It’s not that you did anything, it’s me. I am working on it.”

She wiped her eyes and thought about what I said.

“I’m sorry the people are being mean to you. I think your the best person in the world. I love you brother, and I want to help.”

“You just did. Also, was there something you needed.”

“Oh yeah! I almost forgot, your friend is here! He REALLY wants to see you.” I gulped.

He? That could be one of two people and I don’t want to see either of them.

Cyrus, probably wants to talk. I upset him yesterday and the last thing I need is to recap yesterday.

And Walker, he is probably here to yell at me. We ended things as well as we could but, he could easily blame me for what’s happening. Even if I didn’t place the picture there, I was the one who got caught kissing him.

As I approached the door I was startled, TJ Kippen was standing at the door. He was someone I never expect to see. He is always in his room when I was at Ambers. So. for him to be here is kinda…

Nerve racking?

“Hey man!” He smiles as I enter the doorway. I give him an awkward bro hug and it just got more confusing.

“Hey, what are you doing here?”

His smile drops, “Actually I’m here to talk. Is there somewhere we can go?”

“Um, yeah my rooms in the very back to the left.”

As we walked down the hall my mind spiraled just trying to process what was happening, why was he here?

To yell?

To blame me?

To hurt me?

Definitely not to listen. I did JUST break up with his sister.

He walks into my room. He sees the baseball I have laying on the floor, he picks it up. He sits on my bed and starts tossing it back and forth in his hands.

Left

Right

Left

Right

The pace the ball was going was relaxing to me I was able to steady my breathing to the speed of the ball.

In

Out

In

Out

The stress inside my head minimized. I looked away from the ball and pulled a rolly-chair up to my bed. I looked up and met his eyes. The air grew awkward as we sat in silence, I noticed he wasn’t looking at me. Rather, he was staring at the ball. Almost like his life depended on it. I coughed to make some attempt of getting his attention. His eyes slowly drifted to mine and he opened his mouth to say something but shut it before anything came out. Almost like he was ashamed.

“TJ, I don’t mind you being here but if your here to scream at me can we go ahead and get it over with. I get you think I’m this monster, but I did nothing to Amber. She was aware of my situation and she fully accepted it. That picture was taken before I even started dating Amber. So, if your going to do something do it.” I say this while being shocked by my confidence. I never have stood up to anyone but this is the time I did.

I stood up and spread my arms out. I was hoping this would make the whole beating up process easier. As I stand there I hear him laugh.

Laugh?

Why is he laughing?

He should be punching, or kicking, or something??

He looks at me and he says “Bro, you more chill then I thought. Obviously we’re cool. Amber knew the relationship was over way before this, she actually wanted to come and apologize for her, since she knew you probably didn’t want to see her.”

“Oh” I mutter. As I hear my subconscious scream at me how stupid I am. Of course that’s why he’s here. He wouldn’t just stumble here on his own.

“I actually was going to come talk to you even if she didn’t force me down here.”

“Why? No offense to you though, I mean we just haven’t talked before and with recent events you probably I didn’t think you would want to see me anyway. I know I should have probably stopped by your room and said hi before. It’s just that the school kinda makes you out to be this monster. NOT THAT YOU ARE A MONSTER. I was just saying the school thinks that, when it’s totally not true. Also I’ve rambling haven’t I? Wow most people can’t get three words out of me but I am going on and on and on. I’m stopping… Now.”

“I take back my chill statement from before.” He smiles. “Also I get that this is weird, me being here and all. I just wanted to make sure you were ok.”

“Yeah, I’m fine” I say in a completely monotone manor.

“Look you don’t have to lie, I get what your going through.”

He rest my hand on my shoulder. I remove it immediately not wanting to seem rude, I just don’t like being touched. It makes me feel awkward, and I know he doesn’t mean anything by it. I just can’t focus on anything other than his hand on me, if his hands on me.

I realize I’m focused on the wrong thing and redirect my attention to the conversation in front of me.

Him?

He has the perfect life. He wouldn’t know what I’m going through AT ALL! In fact, that couldn’t be farther from the truth! What he said definitely rubbed me the wrong way, and I’m going to let him know it!

“You, what on EARTH would you know about what I’m going through.” I feel a tear form in my eye. “I HAVE NO ONE! NO ONE UNDERSTANDS! ESPECIALLY NOT YOU! MR.BASKETBALL MAN! THAT’S ALL YOU ARE, TJ KIPPEN, THE GUY WHO CAN HAVE ANYONE, ANYTIME HE WANTS!”

He looks me in the eyes, “ I was going to be civil Jonah, but screw it.” He says in the deepest, most intimidating voice I’ve ever heard.

“POOR LITTLE JONAH! HE’S SO ALONE! HE ONLY HAS HIS FAMILY AND FRIENDS BY HIS SIDE! POOR LITTLE JONAH! GOT HIS FEELINGS HURT! LET’S ALL FORGET THE FACT THAT I WAS OUTED TO THE WHOLE BASKETBALL TEAM! THAT I LOST THE MAJORITY OF MY FRIENDS! THAT I LOST THE PERSON I LOVED BECAUSE HE WASN’T READY! LET’S ALL FOCUS ON JONAH FLIPPING BECK! NO ONE NEEDS A TJ KIPPEN IN THERE LIFE!” He explodes.

I just stare at him for a second, TJ is gay.

TJ lost people.

TJ is hurt.

TJ came here to feel less alone.

And I once again stepped all over this great person.

What is WRONG with me!

“I-I’m sorry man, I had no idea.”

“It’s good, I paid off the team not to tell anyone. I can’t even imagine having this happen to me. Kids are tough.” He chuckles

“You can say that again.”

He smirks, we sit there for a minute, letting the previous conversation soak in. A lot did happen very fast.

After a minute he gets this look on his face, kinda like he has an idea. He stands up and he says, “We’re gonna do it.”

“Woah man, we’re cool and all but—“

“NO! God no! You are DEFINITELY NOT my type.”

“Then, what did you mean?”

“I MEANT we’re going to go talk to them”

“Oh…” I say slightly confused. Who did he mean by them? He must of picked up on the not so subtle clues that I had no idea what he meant because he explained further.

“YOUR going to talk to picture boy, and I’M going to talk to my once in a million.”

“OH! I get—, picture boy? You don’t know who it is?”

“No man, the picture was taken at a weird angle. You can only make out who you are, don’t you check your phone? Who is picture boy is trending.”

“What? no, No, NO! This can’t- can’t be happening.”

I lose my perception what reality as my head spins. I can’t breathe and feel myself slide to the floor. I feel like I’m dying as the world gets smaller around me. I can only think of how mad Walkers going to be when he looks at his phone. I feel myself claw into the rug I next to my bed. “Help!” I make out hoping that someone will hear. I start to slowly hear my Mom’s voice, she tells me that I’m having a panic attack and that it will end. It doesn’t feel like it, but I do slowly feel the air go into my lungs again. I try to focus on that until I get back to where I can recognize what’s happening. TJ is standing at the doorway and my mom has me enveloped in a hug. I am back to being ok.

My mom knows this and stands up. This has so many times now she doesn’t even ask questions, she just leaves.

TJ runs over to me. “Are you ok?”

“Yeah, and I’m ready. Let’s go talk to them.”

“Sweet?” He says.”But first can you explain what just happened?”

“Doesn’t matter it’s all over now.” I want him to believe me because I have anxiety and that was a panic attack. Isn’t a conversation I want to have with a total stranger.

“Right…”

“Plus right now I need to go see Wa—. Er, I mean Picture Boy and you need to see…” I feel myself tense up. I almost said Walker, that would not be good. He could be lying about everything.

“Actually, about that. Let’s not go, my ex and I didn’t end on great terms. I mean we were perfect when we were together, but we both did dumb things. We went from being with each other everyday, to fighting once a week, to a slight ‘hey, how are you?’ in the hallway, to nothing at all.” He admitted

“There’s no guy is there? I mean, you obviously can’t make up a name so I’ll do it for you. Steve Earle! There’s a name. Joseph Maccoby. There’s another! Look, I GOT A LOT TO DEAL WITH AND IF YOUR JUST HERE TO GET INFORMATION ABOUT ME THEN LEAVE! TELL AMBER YOU APOLOGIZED AND JUST L—“

“Marty.” He muttered

“What?”

“MARTY, that’s my ex! You know Marty, your friend Marty, Marty from the party, Marty the ‘basketball man’, Marty who has been with me through EVERYTHING!”

“Marty?”

“Yup” He said, popping the p.

“I’m sorry… again. I just know with the ‘Picture Boy’ craze that’s going on, it’s just hard to trust someone.”

“I get that” he laughed. “You want to go do something?”

“Actually I do need to go talk to, you know..”

“Yeah ok, I’ll go then.”

“Bye TJ”

He exits my room. I’m left to progress what just happened. TJ just talked to me. TJ is gay and dated Marty. Is Marty gay? He seems so close to Buffy. Is there a way to like both? Ugh it’s too confusing.

Back to that Picture Boy thing, was that real? I grabbed my phone and power it on. I cut it off last night because of all of the spamming. I go to Twitter and see that, sure enough, you don’t see Walker very well in the picture. People are trying to guess who it is. I laugh at some that are obviously jokes, I mean I couldn’t see some of them with me in a million years. There were none that even pointed toward Walker as a suspect. Still, I probably do need to talk to him.

I went to my contacts and scrolled and finally landed on his name.

Me: Hello Mr. Picture Boy

Deleted

Me: Been awhile…

Deleted

Me: So how are you?

Deleted

Me: I’m coming over.

Sent

I decided I would have to do this in person, I don’t like talking on the phone, and you can overthink while texting. I need to see him, talk to him, and hear him.

I go over to my closet and try to decide which outfit goes with “Sorry I almost outed you and I hope we can still be friends.” God this is a disaster. Just like me I guess. A disaster. I’m just like a hurricane, I leave a mess everywhere I go and I leave people hurt with no turning back.

I finally decide on my gray shirt Amber bought me for my birthday. I’m not gonna lie it is super comfortable. She did always know what I want, but what she’s done is unforgivable. After I get back from Walkers I fully plan to bury myself under a pound of blankets and cry until the sweet release of death.

I go down street and started counting, when we were together I figured out it took exactly 230 steps to get to his house. So, it became a habit to count on the way there.

As I reached the 200s my heart began to pound. I was not prepared for what I was throwing myself into.

210. Almost there.

220. I’m right next to his house.

230. I’m there.

I knocked on his door. “Here we go.” I whispered under my breath.

The door opens to reveal his beautiful mother, wearing another outfit Walker designed. His parents are so supportive of his dreams of being a designer, when my dad was around the only option for me was the army. Secretly though, I would try to learn guitar. I borrowed one from Gus’s dad from time to time. I feel like if I had a good teacher, I might be able to go somewhere. Not that my mom could afford it. So I guess for now no dreams is what I can manage.

“Jonah! Sweetheart, it’s been too long, how are you?” She says as she hugs me.

“Hey Violet, I’m great.” I say a little too enthusiastically. “I love the dress is it new?”

“Yep, Walk just made it last week.”

“Well it suits you. Speaking of Walk, is he home?”

She sighs,”Yeah but he’s in a mood, won’t let anyone in.”

“Can I give it a go?”

“Sure, but say hi to Marcus on the way. We both have really missed you.”

“I’ve missed you guys too. Life just gets in the way sometimes.” I laugh nervously, obviously they don’t know what happened between us. I’m not going to be the one to tell them that their son and I are in some deep trouble right now.

“Well, I get that.” She laughs.

I decide that’s my time to leave. I run across the house, straight to Walker’s door. I took a deep breath to prepare for the storm of hate and rage that was about to hit me.

*Knock Knock Knock*

“GO AWAY DAD! I DON’T WANT TO TALK ABOUT GIRLS ANYMORE!”

Dang he is mad.

“Hot Fudge Sundae” I whispered. We came up with the code right after our first date. It lets us know that it’s each other. My code is hot fudge sundae, and his is painted smiles.

“Jonah?”

“Yeah it’s me. Can I come in?”

“Yes just don’t let anyone follow you.”

I slowly opened the door, I saw him wrapped in a blanket. He had puffy eyes that matched mine. He obviously didn’t need to be informed on what had happened.

“Are you ok?” I asked. I already knew the answer but I didn’t know how else to start this conversation.

“I should be asking you that.” He said.

He honestly has never sounded worse. I climbed up beside him in the bed and he laid his head on my shoulder. Just like in the good old days.

“Are you mad at me?”

“No.”

“I figured you would be, having been a victim of my locker and all”

He half smiled “I wouldn’t think you put it there yourself, heck, you didn’t know what to identify as a month ago. Did you ever figure that out?”

“Nope, all I know is I’m a little more confused everyday. And you, did you ever pick a label?”

“Right now, I like pansexual. I feel like it describes me pretty well.”

“That’s great… What exactly is that?”

He laughed a little “I pretty much fall for someone’s personality rather than their gender. I do have a slight preference to males, but I’m open to any gender.”

“Oh, I didn’t know that existed. Your right though, it does suit you.”

He smiles at me, and I smiled back. I’m happy for Walk, it must be comforting to know what you are.

“Hey? We’re going to be ok, right? Like, this will end eventually?” I asked

“I honestly don’t know Jo, I wish I could tell you yes, but kids are so… What’s the word?”

“Cruel, hateful, clueless, closed-minded?”

“Yeah…” He says looking away.

We sat there in this silence for awhile. We used to do this for hours, just be with each other. I missed it so much. I don’t like him anymore but I do need him, as my best friend right now. He gets it, what I’m going through, how hard it’s been, how lonely it is.

All of it.

It’s easy to rely on the ones you trust. Which why it’s different then someone like TJ or Cyrus. Sure, they seem nice but I don’t trust them yet. As I grew deeper into my thinking, I felt Walker grab my hand.

I pulled away.

“Don’t” I mumble verily loud enough to hear.

He turn to look at me. “Why?”

“I can’t do this again, Walk, I know times are tough right now. I mean that, but if we go back to how we were we’ll get hurt again. I loved you, and I still do. I just know that we both aren’t mentally stable enough to be together. Not yet.”

He sat up and moved to the foot of his bed to face me. “I know, I’ve just missed you so much. I won’t do it again, I promise, just don’t—“

“Just don’t what?”

“Just don’t leave again. I can handle being friends, and just to let you know I’ve started therapy. I got antidepressants, they work, for the most part. Some days are still tough though. Like today, the locker thing hit me hard, not gonna lie. Then, my dad came up here, and when refused to open the door, he was convinced it because of some girl. It just reminded me that I’m still not as open, or out, as I want to be. It hurts so much Jonah. I used to talk to you about this stuff, then you quit coming around. I get that though. I’ve just been so alone.” He cried.

I pulled him into a hug and after a couple minutes I pulled away.

“I know I left. That’s why I didn’t want you close. I push those people away, especially when they need me. I get scared then, I hurt them. We both fell victim though, it hurt so much to leave you. I forced myself not to return, I knew we pulling each other down, instead of lifting each other up. I wasn’t going to let that happen. We agreed on that. I am here when you need me though. I might not be much help but I will listen.” I said trying to defend myself.

He sat there a second, looking at the stars on his ceiling. Then after about two minutes of saying nothing, he got up and went to his closet, he came back with face paint and brushes.

“I hope you don’t mind but it’s getting kind of serious and I think we both could use a little light heartedness.”

“I’d love that.” I grinned.

We both started grabbing colors and brushes. Then I went first. He wanted something goofy, something to make him laugh. So I did the best thing possible, which was turn his head into a giant cheeseburger. As I started on the bun I began to attempt to catch up on what’s been going on.

“I liked your Mom’s new dress. It had a lot more detail in it then the ones she wore when I was last around.”

He looked amused. “Yeah, took a couple classes and picked up some new techniques.”

“Well they look great.”

“I might need to change them then.”

“Why?”

“No offense, but you have no taste sweetie.” He joked

“Shut up!”

“Will not.”

Within no time were busting out laughing at old memories and inside jokes. It honestly felt so good to be back. It made me happier than I had been in awhile.

“You remember the time we tried to do a piggyback race with your sister and Kaylee?”

“Yeah, we ended up just falling over because SOMEONE said I was too heavy.”

“WELL I NEVER SAID I WAS AN ATHLETE!”

I missed joking around with him he was my best friend, I’m so glad I got him back. I mean he was my BEST friend, even before we dated. He would come over to my house all the time, my mom called him her adopted son.

“So how’s Laura aka my mom?”

“My moms as good as she can be.” I laughed

“So? Still utterly clueless?”

“At this point I could write depressed on my head, kiss a guy, and have a panic attack right in front of her, and she still wouldn’t know what was going on.”

“Please, at least she isn’t always in your business. I’m surprised I’m still closeted after all the ‘girl talks’ my dad has had with me.”

“Yikes.”

“Yeah, he’s gonna be so disappointed when he finds out. I’m not even that worried about my mom. She’s so loving that it literally wouldn’t change anything.”

“At least your mom and dad are still here.” I wasn’t thinking when I said that. The room fell to a hush. We sat there in silence as I finished the last few designs.

“…and done” I say after finishing my master piece.

He went over to the mirror and instantly fell over from laughing.

“Nice one Ronald McDonald.” He mocks.

“Like you’ll do any better.” I say, knowing very well his will be a trillion times better.

He begins his with a dark brown and continues our conversation.

“So when do you think you’ll go back to school.”

“Probably around… um… never. Never sounds good.”

“C’mon, it can’t be that bad” he says.

I take out my phone and read him a few of the hundreds of mean comments, texts, voicemails, emails, and tweets, I had been sent.

“Dang that’s tough. How are you staying so strong?” He asked

“Well for the most part my phone is turned off, but occasionally I go on to see who they think you are.”

“Oh I do the same thing! I mean I knew about the hate, but I swear I think they have named everyone except me by now. I don’t know if I should offended or relieved.”

“Relieved, definitely relieved.”

“Good to know, and just to let you know, I don’t regret anything that happened. Sure, I do wish I wasn’t trending with the anonymous ‘Picture Boy’ name, but I wouldn’t take back that kiss.”

“Me either.” I say looking directly in his eyes.

“Friends?” He asked like I was going to reject the offer.

“Friends.” I beamed.

He did a few more touch ups. I could tell because he was super focused and his tongue was sticking out.

“Your done” he exclaimed. I walk over to the mirror and started laughing at the monkey that was now on my face. It was definitely not what I expected. He usually does more detailed designs but this was simple. I really liked it.

As I was sitting back down I glanced up at the clock and noticed how late it had gotten.

“I’m going to take off, it was good seeing you again.”

“Same here.”

I rushed out his house, first stopping to say goodbye to Marcus and Violet. With the monkey still on my face, I sprinted home, just making it by my curfew. As I walked in my mom started laughing.

“You go to Walkers today?”

“Yup” I said as I slowly walked to my room.

“Good I like that kid.”

“I WANT A MONKEY!” Kip chimed in.

Gosh I love that child. I hope she never goes through what I am. I go over and ruffle her hair. She gives a look of shock.

Kip then jumps, landing on me. I tried to hold her up but we both end up in the floor. I begin laughing, hard. She jumps up and runs away screaming, giggles slipping through when she catches her breath. She’s adorable.

I roll over and look up my mom, she had my phone in her hand.

“I’m sorry, i-it was buzzing and I just-“ she stutters.

I half smile, of course this happens. Right when I start to feel better, this stuff happens. It’s almost amusing how my life can’t just be right, not even for a little bit.

I laugh, not a regular laugh. No, it’s deep, bitter, and cold. I’m done with this, not just this, everything.

“Nope” I say as I storm to my room. So much for a good day.

——

Jonah’s painting

Walker’s painting

*knock knock knock*

“Brother are you okay?”

“Kip please leave me alone, I’m dealing with some stuff.” I attempt to say, but I’m just so hoarse. I cried all of last night am now, I’m just laying here.

“Is this because you and Amber broke up?” A tear rolled down my cheek.

Amber was the cause for this, Amber is the reason I have this big hole in my heart. The reason multiple people are hurt. And the reason my school hates me.

“Jonah?”

I storm over to and sling it open. I don’t care if Kip is just a kid, she should learn not to annoy people. She should know that if someone says to leave them alone, they should do it!

“KIP, I SAID LEAVE! WHY ARE YOU STILL HERE! I WANT TO BE ALONE AND ALL YOU DO IS BUG ME! HONESTLY WHY ARE YOU SO ANNOYING!?!”

Her eyes fill with tears and her lip pokes out. I instantly knew I messed up. I’m not mad at her. But I have this rage in my stomach and nowhere to put it.

I hug her and her arms wrap around my waist. As she sobs she apologizes. I feel like the biggest jerk in the universe. She is the best sister a guy could have and I hurt her.

I crouch down so I can meet her eyes. The sweet caramel color matched my mothers. I sadly am cursed with my father’s eyes.

“I am so sorry. I love you so much. Your brother is just dealing with some mean kids right now. When I get sad though, I yell and scream, ok? It’s not that you did anything, it’s me. I am working on it.”

She wiped her eyes and thought about what I said.

“I’m sorry the people are being mean to you. I think your the best person in the world. I love you brother, and I want to help.”

“You just did. Also, was there something you needed.”

“Oh yeah! I almost forgot, your friend is here! He REALLY wants to see you.” I gulped.

He? That could be one of two people and I don’t want to see either of them.

Cyrus, probably wants to talk. I upset him yesterday and the last thing I need is to recap yesterday.

And Walker, he is probably here to yell at me. We ended things as well as we could but, he could easily blame me for what’s happening. Even if I didn’t place the picture there, I was the one who got caught kissing him.

As I approached the door I was startled, TJ Kippen was standing at the door. He was someone I never expect to see. He is always in his room when I was at Ambers. So. for him to be here is kinda…

Nerve racking?

“Hey man!” He smiles as I enter the doorway. I give him an awkward bro hug and it just got more confusing.

“Hey, what are you doing here?”

His smile drops, “Actually I’m here to talk. Is there somewhere we can go?”

“Um, yeah my rooms in the very back to the left.”

As we walked down the hall my mind spiraled just trying to process what was happening, why was he here?

To yell?

To blame me?

To hurt me?

Definitely not to listen. I did JUST break up with his sister.

He walks into my room. He sees the baseball I have laying on the floor, he picks it up. He sits on my bed and starts tossing it back and forth in his hands.

Left

Right

Left

Right

The pace the ball was going was relaxing to me I was able to steady my breathing to the speed of the ball.

In

Out

In

Out

The stress inside my head minimized. I looked away from the ball and pulled a rolly-chair up to my bed. I looked up and met his eyes. The air grew awkward as we sat in silence, I noticed he wasn’t looking at me. Rather, he was staring at the ball. Almost like his life depended on it. I coughed to make some attempt of getting his attention. His eyes slowly drifted to mine and he opened his mouth to say something but shut it before anything came out. Almost like he was ashamed.

“TJ, I don’t mind you being here but if your here to scream at me can we go ahead and get it over with. I get you think I’m this monster, but I did nothing to Amber. She was aware of my situation and she fully accepted it. That picture was taken before I even started dating Amber. So, if your going to do something do it.” I say this while being shocked by my confidence. I never have stood up to anyone but this is the time I did.

I stood up and spread my arms out. I was hoping this would make the whole beating up process easier. As I stand there I hear him laugh.

Laugh?

Why is he laughing?

He should be punching, or kicking, or something??

He looks at me and he says “Bro, you more chill then I thought. Obviously we’re cool. Amber knew the relationship was over way before this, she actually wanted to come and apologize for her, since she knew you probably didn’t want to see her.”

“Oh” I mutter. As I hear my subconscious scream at me how stupid I am. Of course that’s why he’s here. He wouldn’t just stumble here on his own.

“I actually was going to come talk to you even if she didn’t force me down here.”

“Why? No offense to you though, I mean we just haven’t talked before and with recent events you probably I didn’t think you would want to see me anyway. I know I should have probably stopped by your room and said hi before. It’s just that the school kinda makes you out to be this monster. NOT THAT YOU ARE A MONSTER. I was just saying the school thinks that, when it’s totally not true. Also I’ve rambling haven’t I? Wow most people can’t get three words out of me but I am going on and on and on. I’m stopping… Now.”

“I take back my chill statement from before.” He smiles. “Also I get that this is weird, me being here and all. I just wanted to make sure you were ok.”

“Yeah, I’m fine” I say in a completely monotone manor.

“Look you don’t have to lie, I get what your going through.”

He rest my hand on my shoulder. I remove it immediately not wanting to seem rude, I just don’t like being touched. It makes me feel awkward, and I know he doesn’t mean anything by it. I just can’t focus on anything other than his hand on me, if his hands on me.

I realize I’m focused on the wrong thing and redirect my attention to the conversation in front of me.

Him?

He has the perfect life. He wouldn’t know what I’m going through AT ALL! In fact, that couldn’t be farther from the truth! What he said definitely rubbed me the wrong way, and I’m going to let him know it!

“You, what on EARTH would you know about what I’m going through.” I feel a tear form in my eye. “I HAVE NO ONE! NO ONE UNDERSTANDS! ESPECIALLY NOT YOU! MR.BASKETBALL MAN! THAT’S ALL YOU ARE, TJ KIPPEN, THE GUY WHO CAN HAVE ANYONE, ANYTIME HE WANTS!”

He looks me in the eyes, “ I was going to be civil Jonah, but screw it.” He says in the deepest, most intimidating voice I’ve ever heard.

“POOR LITTLE JONAH! HE’S SO ALONE! HE ONLY HAS HIS FAMILY AND FRIENDS BY HIS SIDE! POOR LITTLE JONAH! GOT HIS FEELINGS HURT! LET’S ALL FORGET THE FACT THAT I WAS OUTED TO THE WHOLE BASKETBALL TEAM! THAT I LOST THE MAJORITY OF MY FRIENDS! THAT I LOST THE PERSON I LOVED BECAUSE HE WASN’T READY! LET’S ALL FOCUS ON JONAH FLIPPING BECK! NO ONE NEEDS A TJ KIPPEN IN THERE LIFE!” He explodes.

I just stare at him for a second, TJ is gay.

TJ lost people.

TJ is hurt.

TJ came here to feel less alone.

And I once again stepped all over this great person.

What is WRONG with me!

“I-I’m sorry man, I had no idea.”

“It’s good, I paid off the team not to tell anyone. I can’t even imagine having this happen to me. Kids are tough.” He chuckles

“You can say that again.”

He smirks, we sit there for a minute, letting the previous conversation soak in. A lot did happen very fast.

After a minute he gets this look on his face, kinda like he has an idea. He stands up and he says, “We’re gonna do it.”

“Woah man, we’re cool and all but—“

“NO! God no! You are DEFINITELY NOT my type.”

“Then, what did you mean?”

“I MEANT we’re going to go talk to them”

“Oh…” I say slightly confused. Who did he mean by them? He must of picked up on the not so subtle clues that I had no idea what he meant because he explained further.

“YOUR going to talk to picture boy, and I’M going to talk to my once in a million.”

“OH! I get—, picture boy? You don’t know who it is?”

“No man, the picture was taken at a weird angle. You can only make out who you are, don’t you check your phone? Who is picture boy is trending.”

“What? no, No, NO! This can’t- can’t be happening.”

I lose my perception what reality as my head spins. I can’t breathe and feel myself slide to the floor. I feel like I’m dying as the world gets smaller around me. I can only think of how mad Walkers going to be when he looks at his phone. I feel myself claw into the rug I next to my bed. “Help!” I make out hoping that someone will hear. I start to slowly hear my Mom’s voice, she tells me that I’m having a panic attack and that it will end. It doesn’t feel like it, but I do slowly feel the air go into my lungs again. I try to focus on that until I get back to where I can recognize what’s happening. TJ is standing at the doorway and my mom has me enveloped in a hug. I am back to being ok.

My mom knows this and stands up. This has so many times now she doesn’t even ask questions, she just leaves.

TJ runs over to me. “Are you ok?”

“Yeah, and I’m ready. Let’s go talk to them.”

“Sweet?” He says.”But first can you explain what just happened?”

“Doesn’t matter it’s all over now.” I want him to believe me because I have anxiety and that was a panic attack. Isn’t a conversation I want to have with a total stranger.

“Right…”

“Plus right now I need to go see Wa—. Er, I mean Picture Boy and you need to see…” I feel myself tense up. I almost said Walker, that would not be good. He could be lying about everything.

“Actually, about that. Let’s not go, my ex and I didn’t end on great terms. I mean we were perfect when we were together, but we both did dumb things. We went from being with each other everyday, to fighting once a week, to a slight ‘hey, how are you?’ in the hallway, to nothing at all.” He admitted

“There’s no guy is there? I mean, you obviously can’t make up a name so I’ll do it for you. Steve Earle! There’s a name. Joseph Maccoby. There’s another! Look, I GOT A LOT TO DEAL WITH AND IF YOUR JUST HERE TO GET INFORMATION ABOUT ME THEN LEAVE! TELL AMBER YOU APOLOGIZED AND JUST L—“

“Marty.” He muttered

“What?”

“MARTY, that’s my ex! You know Marty, your friend Marty, Marty from the party, Marty the ‘basketball man’, Marty who has been with me through EVERYTHING!”

“Marty?”

“Yup” He said, popping the p.

“I’m sorry… again. I just know with the ‘Picture Boy’ craze that’s going on, it’s just hard to trust someone.”

“I get that” he laughed. “You want to go do something?”

“Actually I do need to go talk to, you know..”

“Yeah ok, I’ll go then.”

“Bye TJ”

He exits my room. I’m left to progress what just happened. TJ just talked to me. TJ is gay and dated Marty. Is Marty gay? He seems so close to Buffy. Is there a way to like both? Ugh it’s too confusing.

Back to that Picture Boy thing, was that real? I grabbed my phone and power it on. I cut it off last night because of all of the spamming. I go to Twitter and see that, sure enough, you don’t see Walker very well in the picture. People are trying to guess who it is. I laugh at some that are obviously jokes, I mean I couldn’t see some of them with me in a million years. There were none that even pointed toward Walker as a suspect. Still, I probably do need to talk to him.

I went to my contacts and scrolled and finally landed on his name.

Me: Hello Mr. Picture Boy

I decided I would have to do this in person, I don’t like talking on the phone, and you can overthink while texting. I need to see him, talk to him, and hear him.

I go over to my closet and try to decide which outfit goes with “Sorry I almost outed you and I hope we can still be friends.” God this is a disaster. Just like me I guess. A disaster. I’m just like a hurricane, I leave a mess everywhere I go and I leave people hurt with no turning back.

I finally decide on my gray shirt Amber bought me for my birthday. I’m not gonna lie it is super comfortable. She did always know what I want, but what she’s done is unforgivable. After I get back from Walkers I fully plan to bury myself under a pound of blankets and cry until the sweet release of death.

I go down street and started counting, when we were together I figured out it took exactly 230 steps to get to his house. So, it became a habit to count on the way there.

As I reached the 200s my heart began to pound. I was not prepared for what I was throwing myself into.

210. Almost there.

220. I’m right next to his house.

230. I’m there.

I knocked on his door. “Here we go.” I whispered under my breath.

The door opens to reveal his beautiful mother, wearing another outfit Walker designed. His parents are so supportive of his dreams of being a designer, when my dad was around the only option for me was the army. Secretly though, I would try to learn guitar. I borrowed one from Gus’s dad from time to time. I feel like if I had a good teacher, I might be able to go somewhere. Not that my mom could afford it. So I guess for now no dreams is what I can manage.

“Jonah! Sweetheart, it’s been too long, how are you?” She says as she hugs me.

“Hey Violet, I’m great.” I say a little too enthusiastically. “I love the dress is it new?”

“Yep, Walk just made it last week.”

“Well it suits you. Speaking of Walk, is he home?”

She sighs,”Yeah but he’s in a mood, won’t let anyone in.”

“Can I give it a go?”

“Sure, but say hi to Marcus on the way. We both have really missed you.”

“I’ve missed you guys too. Life just gets in the way sometimes.” I laugh nervously, obviously they don’t know what happened between us. I’m not going to be the one to tell them that their son and I are in some deep trouble right now.

“Well, I get that.” She laughs.

I decide that’s my time to leave. I run across the house, straight to Walker’s door. I took a deep breath to prepare for the storm of hate and rage that was about to hit me.

*Knock Knock Knock*

“GO AWAY DAD! I DON’T WANT TO TALK ABOUT GIRLS ANYMORE!”

Dang he is mad.

“Hot Fudge Sundae” I whispered. We came up with the code right after our first date. It lets us know that it’s each other. My code is hot fudge sundae, and his is painted smiles.

“Jonah?”

“Yeah it’s me. Can I come in?”

“Yes just don’t let anyone follow you.”

I slowly opened the door, I saw him wrapped in a blanket. He had puffy eyes that matched mine. He obviously didn’t need to be informed on what had happened.

“Are you ok?” I asked. I already knew the answer but I didn’t know how else to start this conversation.

“I should be asking you that.” He said.

He honestly has never sounded worse. I climbed up beside him in the bed and he laid his head on my shoulder. Just like in the good old days.

“Are you mad at me?”

“No.”

“I figured you would be, having been a victim of my locker and all”

He half smiled “I wouldn’t think you put it there yourself, heck, you didn’t know what to identify as a month ago. Did you ever figure that out?”

“Nope, all I know is I’m a little more confused everyday. And you, did you ever pick a label?”

“Right now, I like pansexual. I feel like it describes me pretty well.”

“That’s great… What exactly is that?”

He laughed a little “I pretty much fall for someone’s personality rather than their gender. I do have a slight preference to males, but I’m open to any gender.”

“Oh, I didn’t know that existed. Your right though, it does suit you.”

He smiles at me, and I smiled back. I’m happy for Walk, it must be comforting to know what you are.

“Hey? We’re going to be ok, right? Like, this will end eventually?” I asked

“I honestly don’t know Jo, I wish I could tell you yes, but kids are so… What’s the word?”

“Cruel, hateful, clueless, closed-minded?”

“Yeah…” He says looking away.

We sat there in this silence for awhile. We used to do this for hours, just be with each other. I missed it so much. I don’t like him anymore but I do need him, as my best friend right now. He gets it, what I’m going through, how hard it’s been, how lonely it is.

All of it.

It’s easy to rely on the ones you trust. Which why it’s different then someone like TJ or Cyrus. Sure, they seem nice but I don’t trust them yet. As I grew deeper into my thinking, I felt Walker grab my hand.

I pulled away.

“Don’t” I mumble verily loud enough to hear.

He turn to look at me. “Why?”

“I can’t do this again, Walk, I know times are tough right now. I mean that, but if we go back to how we were we’ll get hurt again. I loved you, and I still do. I just know that we both aren’t mentally stable enough to be together. Not yet.”

He sat up and moved to the foot of his bed to face me. “I know, I’ve just missed you so much. I won’t do it again, I promise, just don’t—“

“Just don’t what?”

“Just don’t leave again. I can handle being friends, and just to let you know I’ve started therapy. I got antidepressants, they work, for the most part. Some days are still tough though. Like today, the locker thing hit me hard, not gonna lie. Then, my dad came up here, and when refused to open the door, he was convinced it because of some girl. It just reminded me that I’m still not as open, or out, as I want to be. It hurts so much Jonah. I used to talk to you about this stuff, then you quit coming around. I get that though. I’ve just been so alone.” He cried.

I pulled him into a hug and after a couple minutes I pulled away.

“I know I left. That’s why I didn’t want you close. I push those people away, especially when they need me. I get scared then, I hurt them. We both fell victim though, it hurt so much to leave you. I forced myself not to return, I knew we pulling each other down, instead of lifting each other up. I wasn’t going to let that happen. We agreed on that. I am here when you need me though. I might not be much help but I will listen.” I said trying to defend myself.

He sat there a second, looking at the stars on his ceiling. Then after about two minutes of saying nothing, he got up and went to his closet, he came back with face paint and brushes.

“I hope you don’t mind but it’s getting kind of serious and I think we both could use a little light heartedness.”

“I’d love that.” I grinned.

We both started grabbing colors and brushes. Then I went first. He wanted something goofy, something to make him laugh. So I did the best thing possible, which was turn his head into a giant cheeseburger. As I started on the bun I began to attempt to catch up on what’s been going on.

“I liked your Mom’s new dress. It had a lot more detail in it then the ones she wore when I was last around.”

He looked amused. “Yeah, took a couple classes and picked up some new techniques.”

“Well they look great.”

“I might need to change them then.”

“Why?”

“No offense, but you have no taste sweetie.” He joked

“Shut up!”

“Will not.”

Within no time were busting out laughing at old memories and inside jokes. It honestly felt so good to be back. It made me happier than I had been in awhile.

“You remember the time we tried to do a piggyback race with your sister and Kaylee?”

“Yeah, we ended up just falling over because SOMEONE said I was too heavy.”

“WELL I NEVER SAID I WAS AN ATHLETE!”

I missed joking around with him he was my best friend, I’m so glad I got him back. I mean he was my BEST friend, even before we dated. He would come over to my house all the time, my mom called him her adopted son.

“So how’s Laura aka my mom?”

“My moms as good as she can be.” I laughed

“So? Still utterly clueless?”

“At this point I could write depressed on my head, kiss a guy, and have a panic attack right in front of her, and she still wouldn’t know what was going on.”

“Please, at least she isn’t always in your business. I’m surprised I’m still closeted after all the ‘girl talks’ my dad has had with me.”

“Yikes.”

“Yeah, he’s gonna be so disappointed when he finds out. I’m not even that worried about my mom. She’s so loving that it literally wouldn’t change anything.”

“At least your mom and dad are still here.” I wasn’t thinking when I said that. The room fell to a hush. We sat there in silence as I finished the last few designs.

“…and done” I say after finishing my master piece.

He went over to the mirror and instantly fell over from laughing.

“Nice one Ronald McDonald.” He mocks.

“Like you’ll do any better.” I say, knowing very well his will be a trillion times better.

He begins his with a dark brown and continues our conversation.

“So when do you think you’ll go back to school.”

“Probably around… um… never. Never sounds good.”

“C’mon, it can’t be that bad” he says.

I take out my phone and read him a few of the hundreds of mean comments, texts, voicemails, emails, and tweets, I had been sent.

“Dang that’s tough. How are you staying so strong?” He asked

“Well for the most part my phone is turned off, but occasionally I go on to see who they think you are.”

“Oh I do the same thing! I mean I knew about the hate, but I swear I think they have named everyone except me by now. I don’t know if I should offended or relieved.”

“Relieved, definitely relieved.”

“Good to know, and just to let you know, I don’t regret anything that happened. Sure, I do wish I wasn’t trending with the anonymous ‘Picture Boy’ name, but I wouldn’t take back that kiss.”

“Me either.” I say looking directly in his eyes.

“Friends?” He asked like I was going to reject the offer.

“Friends.” I beamed.

He did a few more touch ups. I could tell because he was super focused and his tongue was sticking out.

“Your done” he exclaimed. I walk over to the mirror and started laughing at the monkey that was now on my face. It was definitely not what I expected. He usually does more detailed designs but this was simple. I really liked it.

As I was sitting back down I glanced up at the clock and noticed how late it had gotten.

“I’m going to take off, it was good seeing you again.”

“Same here.”

I rushed out his house, first stopping to say goodbye to Marcus and Violet. With the monkey still on my face, I sprinted home, just making it by my curfew. As I walked in my mom started laughing.

“You go to Walkers today?”

“Yup” I said as I slowly walked to my room.

“Good I like that kid.”

“I WANT A MONKEY!” Kip chimed in.

Gosh I love that child. I hope she never goes through what I am. I go over and ruffle her hair. She gives a look of shock.

Kip then jumps, landing on me. I tried to hold her up but we both end up in the floor. I begin laughing, hard. She jumps up and runs away screaming, giggles slipping through when she catches her breath. She’s adorable.

I roll over and look up my mom, she had my phone in her hand.

“I’m sorry, i-it was buzzing and I just-“ she stutters.

I half smile, of course this happens. Right when I start to feel better, this stuff happens. It’s almost amusing how my life can’t just be right, not even for a little bit.

I laugh, not a regular laugh. No, it’s deep, bitter, and cold. I’m done with this, not just this, everything.

“Nope” I say as I storm to my room. So much for a good day.

——

Jonah’s painting

Walker’s painting

Coping | Part 2

*knock knock knock*

“Brother are you okay?”

“Kip please leave me alone, I’m dealing with some stuff.” I attempt to say, but I’m just so hoarse. I cried all of last night am now, I’m just laying here.

“Is this because you and Amber broke up?” A tear rolled down my cheek.

Amber was the cause for this, Amber is the reason I have this big hole in my heart. The reason multiple people are hurt. And the reason my school hates me.

“Jonah?”

I storm over to and sling it open. I don’t care if Kip is just a kid, she should learn not to annoy people. She should know that if someone says to leave them alone, they should do it!

“KIP, I SAID LEAVE! WHY ARE YOU STILL HERE! I WANT TO BE ALONE AND ALL YOU DO IS BUG ME! HONESTLY WHY ARE YOU SO ANNOYING!?!”

Her eyes fill with tears and her lip pokes out. I instantly knew I messed up. I’m not mad at her. But I have this rage in my stomach and nowhere to put it.

I hug her and her arms wrap around my waist. As she sobs she apologizes. I feel like the biggest jerk in the universe. She is the best sister a guy could have and I hurt her.

I crouch down so I can meet her eyes. The sweet caramel color matched my mothers. I sadly am cursed with my father’s eyes.

“I am so sorry. I love you so much. Your brother is just dealing with some mean kids right now. When I get sad though, I yell and scream, ok? It’s not that you did anything, it’s me. I am working on it.”

She wiped her eyes and thought about what I said.

“I’m sorry the people are being mean to you. I think your the best person in the world. I love you brother, and I want to help.”

“You just did. Also, was there something you needed.”

“Oh yeah! I almost forgot, your friend is here! He REALLY wants to see you.” I gulped.

He? That could be one of two people and I don’t want to see either of them.

Cyrus, probably wants to talk. I upset him yesterday and the last thing I need is to recap yesterday.

And Walker, he is probably here to yell at me. We ended things as well as we could but, he could easily blame me for what’s happening. Even if I didn’t place the picture there, I was the one who got caught kissing him.

As I approached the door I was startled, TJ Kippen was standing at the door. He was someone I never expect to see. He is always in his room when I was at Ambers. So. for him to be here is kinda…

Nerve racking?

“Hey man!” He smiles as I enter the doorway. I give him an awkward bro hug and it just got more confusing.

“Hey, what are you doing here?”

His smile drops, “Actually I’m here to talk. Is there somewhere we can go?”

“Um, yeah my rooms in the very back to the left.”

As we walked down the hall my mind spiraled just trying to process what was happening, why was he here?

To yell?

To blame me?

To hurt me?

Definitely not to listen. I did JUST break up with his sister.

He walks into my room. He sees the baseball I have laying on the floor, he picks it up. He sits on my bed and starts tossing it back and forth in his hands.

Left

Right

Left

Right

The pace the ball was going was relaxing to me I was able to steady my breathing to the speed of the ball.

In

Out

In

Out

The stress inside my head minimized. I looked away from the ball and pulled a rolly-chair up to my bed. I looked up and met his eyes. The air grew awkward as we sat in silence, I noticed he wasn’t looking at me. Rather, he was staring at the ball. Almost like his life depended on it. I coughed to make some attempt of getting his attention. His eyes slowly drifted to mine and he opened his mouth to say something but shut it before anything came out. Almost like he was ashamed.

“TJ, I don’t mind you being here but if your here to scream at me can we go ahead and get it over with. I get you think I’m this monster, but I did nothing to Amber. She was aware of my situation and she fully accepted it. That picture was taken before I even started dating Amber. So, if your going to do something do it.” I say this while being shocked by my confidence. I never have stood up to anyone but this is the time I did.

I stood up and spread my arms out. I was hoping this would make the whole beating up process easier. As I stand there I hear him laugh.

Laugh?

Why is he laughing?

He should be punching, or kicking, or something??

He looks at me and he says “Bro, you more chill then I thought. Obviously we’re cool. Amber knew the relationship was over way before this, she actually wanted to come and apologize for her, since she knew you probably didn’t want to see her.”

“Oh” I mutter. As I hear my subconscious scream at me how stupid I am. Of course that’s why he’s here. He wouldn’t just stumble here on his own.

“I actually was going to come talk to you even if she didn’t force me down here.”

“Why? No offense to you though, I mean we just haven’t talked before and with recent events you probably I didn’t think you would want to see me anyway. I know I should have probably stopped by your room and said hi before. It’s just that the school kinda makes you out to be this monster. NOT THAT YOU ARE A MONSTER. I was just saying the school thinks that, when it’s totally not true. Also I’ve rambling haven’t I? Wow most people can’t get three words out of me but I am going on and on and on. I’m stopping… Now.”

“I take back my chill statement from before.” He smiles. “Also I get that this is weird, me being here and all. I just wanted to make sure you were ok.”

“Yeah, I’m fine” I say in a completely monotone manor.

“Look you don’t have to lie, I get what your going through.”

He rest my hand on my shoulder. I remove it immediately not wanting to seem rude, I just don’t like being touched. It makes me feel awkward, and I know he doesn’t mean anything by it. I just can’t focus on anything other than his hand on me, if his hands on me.

I realize I’m focused on the wrong thing and redirect my attention to the conversation in front of me.

Him?

He has the perfect life. He wouldn’t know what I’m going through AT ALL! In fact, that couldn’t be farther from the truth! What he said definitely rubbed me the wrong way, and I’m going to let him know it!

“You, what on EARTH would you know about what I’m going through.” I feel a tear form in my eye. “I HAVE NO ONE! NO ONE UNDERSTANDS! ESPECIALLY NOT YOU! MR.BASKETBALL MAN! THAT’S ALL YOU ARE, TJ KIPPEN, THE GUY WHO CAN HAVE ANYONE, ANYTIME HE WANTS!”

He looks me in the eyes, “ I was going to be civil Jonah, but screw it.” He says in the deepest, most intimidating voice I’ve ever heard.

“POOR LITTLE JONAH! HE’S SO ALONE! HE ONLY HAS HIS FAMILY AND FRIENDS BY HIS SIDE! POOR LITTLE JONAH! GOT HIS FEELINGS HURT! LET’S ALL FORGET THE FACT THAT I WAS OUTED TO THE WHOLE BASKETBALL TEAM! THAT I LOST THE MAJORITY OF MY FRIENDS! THAT I LOST THE PERSON I LOVED BECAUSE HE WASN’T READY! LET’S ALL FOCUS ON JONAH FLIPPING BECK! NO ONE NEEDS A TJ KIPPEN IN THERE LIFE!” He explodes.

I just stare at him for a second, TJ is gay.

TJ lost people.

TJ is hurt.

TJ came here to feel less alone.

And I once again stepped all over this great person.

What is WRONG with me!

“I-I’m sorry man, I had no idea.”

“It’s good, I paid off the team not to tell anyone. I can’t even imagine having this happen to me. Kids are tough.” He chuckles

“You can say that again.”

He smirks, we sit there for a minute, letting the previous conversation soak in. A lot did happen very fast.

After a minute he gets this look on his face, kinda like he has an idea. He stands up and he says, “We’re gonna do it.”

“Woah man, we’re cool and all but—“

“NO! God no! You are DEFINITELY NOT my type.”

“Then, what did you mean?”

“I MEANT we’re going to go talk to them”

“Oh…” I say slightly confused. Who did he mean by them? He must of picked up on the not so subtle clues that I had no idea what he meant because he explained further.

“YOUR going to talk to picture boy, and I’M going to talk to my once in a million.”

“OH! I get—, picture boy? You don’t know who it is?”

“No man, the picture was taken at a weird angle. You can only make out who you are, don’t you check your phone? Who is picture boy is trending.”

“What? no, No, NO! This can’t- can’t be happening.”

I lose my perception what reality as my head spins. I can’t breathe and feel myself slide to the floor. I feel like I’m dying as the world gets smaller around me. I can only think of how mad Walkers going to be when he looks at his phone. I feel myself claw into the rug I next to my bed. “Help!” I make out hoping that someone will hear. I start to slowly hear my Mom’s voice, she tells me that I’m having a panic attack and that it will end. It doesn’t feel like it, but I do slowly feel the air go into my lungs again. I try to focus on that until I get back to where I can recognize what’s happening. TJ is standing at the doorway and my mom has me enveloped in a hug. I am back to being ok.

My mom knows this and stands up. This has so many times now she doesn’t even ask questions, she just leaves.

TJ runs over to me. “Are you ok?”

“Yeah, and I’m ready. Let’s go talk to them.”

“Sweet?” He says.”But first can you explain what just happened?”

“Doesn’t matter it’s all over now.” I want him to believe me because I have anxiety and that was a panic attack. Isn’t a conversation I want to have with a total stranger.

“Right…”

“Plus right now I need to go see Wa—. Er, I mean Picture Boy and you need to see…” I feel myself tense up. I almost said Walker, that would not be good. He could be lying about everything.

“Actually, about that. Let’s not go, my ex and I didn’t end on great terms. I mean we were perfect when we were together, but we both did dumb things. We went from being with each other everyday, to fighting once a week, to a slight ‘hey, how are you?’ in the hallway, to nothing at all.” He admitted

“There’s no guy is there? I mean, you obviously can’t make up a name so I’ll do it for you. Steve Earle! There’s a name. Joseph Maccoby. There’s another! Look, I GOT A LOT TO DEAL WITH AND IF YOUR JUST HERE TO GET INFORMATION ABOUT ME THEN LEAVE! TELL AMBER YOU APOLOGIZED AND JUST L—“

“Marty.” He muttered

“What?”

“MARTY, that’s my ex! You know Marty, your friend Marty, Marty from the party, Marty the ‘basketball man’, Marty who has been with me through EVERYTHING!”

“Marty?”

“Yup” He said, popping the p.

“I’m sorry… again. I just know with the ‘Picture Boy’ craze that’s going on, it’s just hard to trust someone.”

“I get that” he laughed. “You want to go do something?”

“Actually I do need to go talk to, you know..”

“Yeah ok, I’ll go then.”

“Bye TJ”

He exits my room. I’m left to progress what just happened. TJ just talked to me. TJ is gay and dated Marty. Is Marty gay? He seems so close to Buffy. Is there a way to like both? Ugh it’s too confusing.

Back to that Picture Boy thing, was that real? I grabbed my phone and power it on. I cut it off last night because of all of the spamming. I go to Twitter and see that, sure enough, you don’t see Walker very well in the picture. People are trying to guess who it is. I laugh at some that are obviously jokes, I mean I couldn’t see some of them with me in a million years. There were none that even pointed toward Walker as a suspect. Still, I probably do need to talk to him.

I went to my contacts and scrolled and finally landed on his name.

Me: Hello Mr. Picture Boy
