Sent

I decided I would have to do this in person, I don’t like talking on the phone, and you can overthink while texting. I need to see him, talk to him, and hear him.

I go over to my closet and try to decide which outfit goes with “Sorry I almost outed you and I hope we can still be friends.” God this is a disaster. Just like me I guess. A disaster. I’m just like a hurricane, I leave a mess everywhere I go and I leave people hurt with no turning back.

I finally decide on my gray shirt Amber bought me for my birthday. I’m not gonna lie it is super comfortable. She did always know what I want, but what she’s done is unforgivable. After I get back from Walkers I fully plan to bury myself under a pound of blankets and cry until the sweet release of death.

I go down street and started counting, when we were together I figured out it took exactly 230 steps to get to his house. So, it became a habit to count on the way there.

As I reached the 200s my heart began to pound. I was not prepared for what I was throwing myself into.

210. Almost there.

220. I’m right next to his house.

230. I’m there.

I knocked on his door. “Here we go.” I whispered under my breath.

The door opens to reveal his beautiful mother, wearing another outfit Walker designed. His parents are so supportive of his dreams of being a designer, when my dad was around the only option for me was the army. Secretly though, I would try to learn guitar. I borrowed one from Gus’s dad from time to time. I feel like if I had a good teacher, I might be able to go somewhere. Not that my mom could afford it. So I guess for now no dreams is what I can manage.

“Jonah! Sweetheart, it’s been too long, how are you?” She says as she hugs me.

“Hey Violet, I’m great.” I say a little too enthusiastically. “I love the dress is it new?”

“Yep, Walk just made it last week.”

“Well it suits you. Speaking of Walk, is he home?”

She sighs,”Yeah but he’s in a mood, won’t let anyone in.”

“Can I give it a go?”

“Sure, but say hi to Marcus on the way. We both have really missed you.”

“I’ve missed you guys too. Life just gets in the way sometimes.” I laugh nervously, obviously they don’t know what happened between us. I’m not going to be the one to tell them that their son and I are in some deep trouble right now.

“Well, I get that.” She laughs.

I decide that’s my time to leave. I run across the house, straight to Walker’s door. I took a deep breath to prepare for the storm of hate and rage that was about to hit me.

*Knock Knock Knock*

“GO AWAY DAD! I DON’T WANT TO TALK ABOUT GIRLS ANYMORE!”

Dang he is mad.

“Hot Fudge Sundae” I whispered. We came up with the code right after our first date. It lets us know that it’s each other. My code is hot fudge sundae, and his is painted smiles.

“Jonah?”

“Yeah it’s me. Can I come in?”

“Yes just don’t let anyone follow you.”

I slowly opened the door, I saw him wrapped in a blanket. He had puffy eyes that matched mine. He obviously didn’t need to be informed on what had happened.

“Are you ok?” I asked. I already knew the answer but I didn’t know how else to start this conversation.

“I should be asking you that.” He said.

He honestly has never sounded worse. I climbed up beside him in the bed and he laid his head on my shoulder. Just like in the good old days.

“Are you mad at me?”

“No.”

“I figured you would be, having been a victim of my locker and all”

He half smiled “I wouldn’t think you put it there yourself, heck, you didn’t know what to identify as a month ago. Did you ever figure that out?”

“Nope, all I know is I’m a little more confused everyday. And you, did you ever pick a label?”

“Right now, I like pansexual. I feel like it describes me pretty well.”

“That’s great… What exactly is that?”

He laughed a little “I pretty much fall for someone’s personality rather than their gender. I do have a slight preference to males, but I’m open to any gender.”

“Oh, I didn’t know that existed. Your right though, it does suit you.”

He smiles at me, and I smiled back. I’m happy for Walk, it must be comforting to know what you are.

“Hey? We’re going to be ok, right? Like, this will end eventually?” I asked

“I honestly don’t know Jo, I wish I could tell you yes, but kids are so… What’s the word?”

“Cruel, hateful, clueless, closed-minded?”

“Yeah…” He says looking away.

We sat there in this silence for awhile. We used to do this for hours, just be with each other. I missed it so much. I don’t like him anymore but I do need him, as my best friend right now. He gets it, what I’m going through, how hard it’s been, how lonely it is.

All of it.

It’s easy to rely on the ones you trust. Which why it’s different then someone like TJ or Cyrus. Sure, they seem nice but I don’t trust them yet. As I grew deeper into my thinking, I felt Walker grab my hand.

I pulled away.

“Don’t” I mumble verily loud enough to hear.

He turn to look at me. “Why?”

“I can’t do this again, Walk, I know times are tough right now. I mean that, but if we go back to how we were we’ll get hurt again. I loved you, and I still do. I just know that we both aren’t mentally stable enough to be together. Not yet.”

He sat up and moved to the foot of his bed to face me. “I know, I’ve just missed you so much. I won’t do it again, I promise, just don’t—“

“Just don’t what?”

“Just don’t leave again. I can handle being friends, and just to let you know I’ve started therapy. I got antidepressants, they work, for the most part. Some days are still tough though. Like today, the locker thing hit me hard, not gonna lie. Then, my dad came up here, and when refused to open the door, he was convinced it because of some girl. It just reminded me that I’m still not as open, or out, as I want to be. It hurts so much Jonah. I used to talk to you about this stuff, then you quit coming around. I get that though. I’ve just been so alone.” He cried.

I pulled him into a hug and after a couple minutes I pulled away.

“I know I left. That’s why I didn’t want you close. I push those people away, especially when they need me. I get scared then, I hurt them. We both fell victim though, it hurt so much to leave you. I forced myself not to return, I knew we pulling each other down, instead of lifting each other up. I wasn’t going to let that happen. We agreed on that. I am here when you need me though. I might not be much help but I will listen.” I said trying to defend myself.

He sat there a second, looking at the stars on his ceiling. Then after about two minutes of saying nothing, he got up and went to his closet, he came back with face paint and brushes.

“I hope you don’t mind but it’s getting kind of serious and I think we both could use a little light heartedness.”

“I’d love that.” I grinned.

We both started grabbing colors and brushes. Then I went first. He wanted something goofy, something to make him laugh. So I did the best thing possible, which was turn his head into a giant cheeseburger. As I started on the bun I began to attempt to catch up on what’s been going on.

“I liked your Mom’s new dress. It had a lot more detail in it then the ones she wore when I was last around.”

He looked amused. “Yeah, took a couple classes and picked up some new techniques.”

“Well they look great.”

“I might need to change them then.”

“Why?”

“No offense, but you have no taste sweetie.” He joked

“Shut up!”

“Will not.”

Within no time were busting out laughing at old memories and inside jokes. It honestly felt so good to be back. It made me happier than I had been in awhile.

“You remember the time we tried to do a piggyback race with your sister and Kaylee?”

“Yeah, we ended up just falling over because SOMEONE said I was too heavy.”

“WELL I NEVER SAID I WAS AN ATHLETE!”

I missed joking around with him he was my best friend, I’m so glad I got him back. I mean he was my BEST friend, even before we dated. He would come over to my house all the time, my mom called him her adopted son.

“So how’s Laura aka my mom?”

“My moms as good as she can be.” I laughed

“So? Still utterly clueless?”

“At this point I could write depressed on my head, kiss a guy, and have a panic attack right in front of her, and she still wouldn’t know what was going on.”

“Please, at least she isn’t always in your business. I’m surprised I’m still closeted after all the ‘girl talks’ my dad has had with me.”

“Yikes.”

“Yeah, he’s gonna be so disappointed when he finds out. I’m not even that worried about my mom. She’s so loving that it literally wouldn’t change anything.”

“At least your mom and dad are still here.” I wasn’t thinking when I said that. The room fell to a hush. We sat there in silence as I finished the last few designs.

“…and done” I say after finishing my master piece.

He went over to the mirror and instantly fell over from laughing.

“Nice one Ronald McDonald.” He mocks.

“Like you’ll do any better.” I say, knowing very well his will be a trillion times better.

He begins his with a dark brown and continues our conversation.

“So when do you think you’ll go back to school.”

“Probably around… um… never. Never sounds good.”

“C’mon, it can’t be that bad” he says.

I take out my phone and read him a few of the hundreds of mean comments, texts, voicemails, emails, and tweets, I had been sent.

“Dang that’s tough. How are you staying so strong?” He asked

“Well for the most part my phone is turned off, but occasionally I go on to see who they think you are.”

“Oh I do the same thing! I mean I knew about the hate, but I swear I think they have named everyone except me by now. I don’t know if I should offended or relieved.”

“Relieved, definitely relieved.”

“Good to know, and just to let you know, I don’t regret anything that happened. Sure, I do wish I wasn’t trending with the anonymous ‘Picture Boy’ name, but I wouldn’t take back that kiss.”

“Me either.” I say looking directly in his eyes.

“Friends?” He asked like I was going to reject the offer.

“Friends.” I beamed.

He did a few more touch ups. I could tell because he was super focused and his tongue was sticking out.

“Your done” he exclaimed. I walk over to the mirror and started laughing at the monkey that was now on my face. It was definitely not what I expected. He usually does more detailed designs but this was simple. I really liked it.

As I was sitting back down I glanced up at the clock and noticed how late it had gotten.

“I’m going to take off, it was good seeing you again.”

“Same here.”

I rushed out his house, first stopping to say goodbye to Marcus and Violet. With the monkey still on my face, I sprinted home, just making it by my curfew. As I walked in my mom started laughing.

“You go to Walkers today?”

“Yup” I said as I slowly walked to my room.

“Good I like that kid.”

“I WANT A MONKEY!” Kip chimed in.

Gosh I love that child. I hope she never goes through what I am. I go over and ruffle her hair. She gives a look of shock.

Kip then jumps, landing on me. I tried to hold her up but we both end up in the floor. I begin laughing, hard. She jumps up and runs away screaming, giggles slipping through when she catches her breath. She’s adorable.

I roll over and look up my mom, she had my phone in her hand.

“I’m sorry, i-it was buzzing and I just-“ she stutters.

I half smile, of course this happens. Right when I start to feel better, this stuff happens. It’s almost amusing how my life can’t just be right, not even for a little bit.

I laugh, not a regular laugh. No, it’s deep, bitter, and cold. I’m done with this, not just this, everything.

“Nope” I say as I storm to my room. So much for a good day.

——

Jonah’s painting

Walker’s painting

summary: the promposal (a tyrus oneshot i wrote for no reason other than “i need fluff”)
body:
the promposal (a tyrus oneshot i wrote for no reason other than “i need fluff”)

apparently i’m too much of a lesbian to describe boys so please bare with me

Word count: 980 words

[this is an entry from cyrus’ journal (because i feel like his parents probably make him keep one)]

It’s been like a week since TJ came out to me and it’s been three days since I told him I was gay and that I liked him. He said he liked me, too, which is what shocked me the most. I never would’ve expected that in my wildest dreams!

Anyway, the ever so elusive prom is coming up next week and I don’t have a date! Shocking! I kind of hoped TJ would ask me since we had that whole ~moment~ the other day, but I guess not. I don’t think I’d ever have the courage to ask him myself, either. Man, I wish he could just read my thoughts so he’d know. Actually, skip that. Maybe that’s not SUCH a great idea.

Buffy and Andi have been bugging me to tell them who I want to go with. Buffy’s going with Marty and Andi was on the decorating committee so she’s not planning on bringing anyone. Amber will probably tag along, though.

After an hour of incessant whining from the two I told them. I don’t know why I wanted to hide it in the first place, honestly. But, yes, TJ is the “lucky guy”. Is he, though? He’s beyond gorgeous. Inside AND out. Those darn green eyes complement his smile so gracefully and his whole face just goes perfectly with his warm laugh (and he smells like strawberries?!). Sometimes (okay, all the time), I want to hug him forever.

Okay, I’m getting off track. TJ’s promposal (I can’t believe I said “promposal”):

So, I learnt how to “shoot hoops” from Buffy (I should say “shoot hoop” because I only got one in the basket). I stole my dad’s CD marker (from his CD burning phase) and wrote, “will you go to prom with me” on an old basketball I found rotting in the garage.

I texted TJ and asked him if he wanted to play some one-on-one. He said, and I quote, “Who are you and what have you done with Cyrus?” (Real sweetheart, isn’t he?)

Regardless, we met at the court in the park and boy, was he shocked to see me carrying my own ball. He came with a large bag, which I assumed was filled with sports… paraphernalia. He set down the bag and said, “Okay, Cyrus, I’ll take it easy on you, don’t worry. Take the ball.” Oh gosh, my heart must have been beating a mile a minute! I was so scared my nervous, sweaty palms would smudge the ink on the ball, even though I KNEW they wouldn’t. Feelings, huh?

He didn’t even TRY to take the ball from me. He just let me shoot! I was hoping he’d take the ball and see what was written on it but he is just as oblivious as he was that day on the swings. I needed to get him to see it SOMEHOW, so after I made the basket (which TJ was IMMENSELY impressed by, btw- it made my heart shiver… in a good way), I said, “Loser takes it out,” (I think I’d heard Buffy say that? I’m probably wrong)

He said, “Hey, someone’s been learning from Buffy!” with that darned smirk of his. Ugh, he’s so cute!

My heart was still beating like a hummingbird as he walked out of the court, but it was now or never (unintentional High School Musical 3 reference, I’m so funny). When he stopped and turned around, ready to play, I said, “Teej, wait! Look at the ball,” (I was just hyperventilating at this point.) He looked down and his eyes got so wide I thought he was going to pass out from the shock! Then, he started RUNNING AWAY (to the bench). Me, being me, shouted something like, “Wait, TJ, I just thought that since we said all that stuff to each other the other day maybe you’d want to go with me! I shouldn’t have jumped the gun, I’m so sorry!” Meanwhile, TJ is still rummaging through his sports bag, trying to find who-knows-what. He shouts back, “No, Cyrus, wait!” still searching his bag.

AND THEN! He pulls out a chocolate chocolate chip muffin (he knows that’s my favourite) wrapped in cling film, and a sort of crumpled up poster (which he’s still trying to unfold). I was extremely confused at this point because I never, in a MILLION YEARS, thought the poster would say, “Muffin would make me happier than going to the prom with you”, while TJ stands there, looking RIGHT into my eyes.

Obviously, I’m a bit dumb and was, as the kids say, shook. I also chose this incredible moment to let my impishness get the better of me. I took the muffin and unwrapped it, not saying a word. I even took a BITE out of the muffin before saying, “I’ll have to think about it,” Honestly, it took ALL my (two) brain cells to stop myself from grinning like a crazy person. But apparently, I’m not as dumb as I thought I was because TJ thought I was being serious when I said that, and started rolling up his poster, looking like he was about to CRY! He started muttering something like, “Oh, yeah! That’s cool, take your time, no problem!”

He had stuffed half the poster in his bag before I could grab his wrist and say, “Teej, I’m joking. I literally learnt how to throw the ball in the thing for this. I want to go with you.”

TJ stared at me for a few seconds and said, “Oh,” smiling like the adorable idiot he is.

And, yeah! So, I guess I’m going to the prom with TJ! Oh, no, what am I going to wear? I hope I don’t smell bad. TJ smells like HEAVEN, I don’t want to smell like garbage in front of HIM! Whatever, that’s a problem for another day.

Regardless, we met at the court in the park and boy, was he shocked to see me carrying my own ball. He came with a large bag, which I assumed was filled with sports… paraphernalia. He set down the bag and said, “Okay, Cyrus, I’ll take it easy on you, don’t worry. Take the ball.” Oh gosh, my heart must have been beating a mile a minute! I was so scared my nervous, sweaty palms would smudge the ink on the ball, even though I KNEW they wouldn’t. Feelings, huh?

He didn’t even TRY to take the ball from me. He just let me shoot! I was hoping he’d take the ball and see what was written on it but he is just as oblivious as he was that day on the swings. I needed to get him to see it SOMEHOW, so after I made the basket (which TJ was IMMENSELY impressed by, btw- it made my heart shiver… in a good way), I said, “Loser takes it out,” (I think I’d heard Buffy say that? I’m probably wrong)

He said, “Hey, someone’s been learning from Buffy!” with that darned smirk of his. Ugh, he’s so cute!

My heart was still beating like a hummingbird as he walked out of the court, but it was now or never (unintentional High School Musical 3 reference, I’m so funny). When he stopped and turned around, ready to play, I said, “Teej, wait! Look at the ball,” (I was just hyperventilating at this point.) He looked down and his eyes got so wide I thought he was going to pass out from the shock! Then, he started RUNNING AWAY (to the bench). Me, being me, shouted something like, “Wait, TJ, I just thought that since we said all that stuff to each other the other day maybe you’d want to go with me! I shouldn’t have jumped the gun, I’m so sorry!” Meanwhile, TJ is still rummaging through his sports bag, trying to find who-knows-what. He shouts back, “No, Cyrus, wait!” still searching his bag.

AND THEN! He pulls out a chocolate chocolate chip muffin (he knows that’s my favourite) wrapped in cling film, and a sort of crumpled up poster (which he’s still trying to unfold). I was extremely confused at this point because I never, in a MILLION YEARS, thought the poster would say, “Muffin would make me happier than going to the prom with you”, while TJ stands there, looking RIGHT into my eyes.

Obviously, I’m a bit dumb and was, as the kids say, shook. I also chose this incredible moment to let my impishness get the better of me. I took the muffin and unwrapped it, not saying a word. I even took a BITE out of the muffin before saying, “I’ll have to think about it,” Honestly, it took ALL my (two) brain cells to stop myself from grinning like a crazy person. But apparently, I’m not as dumb as I thought I was because TJ thought I was being serious when I said that, and started rolling up his poster, looking like he was about to CRY! He started muttering something like, “Oh, yeah! That’s cool, take your time, no problem!”

He had stuffed half the poster in his bag before I could grab his wrist and say, “Teej, I’m joking. I literally learnt how to throw the ball in the thing for this. I want to go with you.”

TJ stared at me for a few seconds and said, “Oh,” smiling like the adorable idiot he is.

And, yeah! So, I guess I’m going to the prom with TJ! Oh, no, what am I going to wear? I hope I don’t smell bad. TJ smells like HEAVEN, I don’t want to smell like garbage in front of HIM! Whatever, that’s a problem for another day.

I don’t think I’d ever have the courage to ask him myself, either. Man, I wish he could just read my thoughts so he’d know. Actually, skip that. Maybe that’s not SUCH a great idea.

summary: I Love You (Tyrus One Shot)
title: I Love You (Tyrus One Shot)
body:
Just a one shot i wrote in like one hour cuz i can’t sleep.

AO3 LINK IN REBLOG

Words: 1378

~~~~~~~

“You know I love you, right?”

Cyrus put down his book and looked up at TJ from where he lay on his lap. The sounds of children playing in the park floated through the air to where they were sitting under the tree. Well, TJ was sitting and Cyrus was lying down. The birds were chirping happily and the sunlight falling on TJ made his hair seem golden from his point of view.

“Oh, the many times you have told me since last week certainly didn’t make that clear.”

That response made TJ stop carding his fingers through Cyrus’ hair, settling for lightly pushing him.

“I’m serious, Underdog!”

“I know, Teej,” Cyrus said, sitting up properly. “I love you too.”

TJ’s face lit up in a soft smile, as he moved his hand down to the back of Cyrus’ neck, pulling him in for a soft kiss. Pulling apart, they just sat in silence for a while, their foreheads resting upon each other, their noses touching.

Cyrus moved away, much to TJ’s disappointment, and marked his place in his book. “How’s practice been these days?”

TJ sighed. “Fine. Everyone’s really worked up about the Finals day after. I’m trying to be encouraging, but I’m actually really worried.”

“Hey,” Cyrus said, putting his hand on TJ’s shoulder. “I’m sure you guys will win. I believe in you.”

TJ smiled back at Cyrus, worry still evident in his eyes. He covered Cyrus’ hand on his shoulder with his own, giving it a grateful squeeze. “Thank you, Cyrus.”

“Besides, I’ll be right there, cheering for you through it all!”

“Don’t know how much that would help,” TJ laughed.

“Wait, why?” Cyrus asked, concerned.

“You’re incredibly distracting!”

Cyrus pushed TJ away, feigning offence. “Oh, really? Fine, I won’t be there then!” he said, crossing his arms.

TJ just chuckled, pulling Cyrus close to him. “No, wait! I take it back. Please be there?” he asked, pouting.

Cyrus lasted all of 2 seconds with his act before he caved and smiled, snaking his arms around TJ’s neck. “Goddamn it, you can’t just put like that and expect me to be okay!”

“What can I say, Muffin? I only have one weapon in my arsenal when it comes to you,” TJ whispered, bumping their noses together, making Cyrus giggle. He pulled TJ in for another kiss.

“Okay, as fun as this is, I’m really hungry right now. What did you get?” TJ asked, pulling away to look in the basket Cyrus got with him. Basket, wow. His boyfriend was extra. And he loved it.

“Take a wild guess.”

“MUFFINS!” TJ said, practically yelling. He was so loud, some moms turned around in surprise.

He pulled out some packets from the basket, containing both chocolate chocolate chip and blueberry macadamia muffins. The latter made TJ hold them up in confusion.

“I thought you said these don’t exist?”

“Well, they do now. Thanks to my impeccable baking skills.”

“Oh god, wow. Cyrus. I knew that we have argued, but I never thought you would ever want to poison me.”

“Hey!” Cyrus said, smacking TJ on the head lightly. “I’ll have you know I am an excellent baker!”

“I’m kidding, Underdog. You could literally give me dirt and I’d eat it,” TJ said, taking a bite of the muffin. At first, he faked happiness until his expression morphed into one of genuine enjoyment.

“Whoa, Cyrus. Holy mother of- this is incredible!”

“Told you,” Cyrus said, pride thrilling through his heart. Well, pride at his baking and just love for the boy sitting next to him.

“Who knew you were a secret Rosanna Pansino?”

Cyrus shrugged, leaning back against the tree, taking another muffin offered to him by TJ.

Everything was peaceful.

*

A couple hours later, the two boys were lying down again, in opposite directions. Cyrus had resumed reading his book, and TJ was busy making daisy chains, even arranging some in Cyrus’ hair. They always had these comfortable silences, the ones where the two didn’t feel the need to speak. They just enjoyed the other’s presence, basking in the warmth that came.

“Hey.”

Cyrus turned to face TJ. He was upside down to Cyrus, but somehow he still managed to take his breath away. At that proximity, he was able to count all the freckles on TJ’s face if he wanted to.

“Hey.”

TJ reached out and stroked Cyrus’ cheek, pulling him in for a kiss. They pulled away, faces still close together. TJ whispered, “I’m so lucky to have met you.”

Cyrus opened his eyes to look at TJ. But for the first time that day, he saw TJ look hesitant.

TJ continued. “The first time I met you, that day in the cafeteria. I went there with the intent to just get Buffy to tutor me, but as soon as I saw you, something changed. Suddenly, I just wanted to help you with anything. I immediately decided that come what may, I won’t let anyone hurt you. I don’t even know why. We didn’t even know each other. But I wanted to get to know you.”

Cyrus stayed silent, curious to hear what TJ wanted to say.

“Then, when we talked at the swings for the first time, I couldn’t bother to put on my ‘mean guy’ mask around you. I just wanted to pour my heart to you. That was the first time I had felt completely free and happy in a long time. And it was thanks to you.”

Cyrus smiled fondly at the memory. He couldn’t have imagined back then what that one conversation would mean down the line.

“I didn’t want anyone to hurt you. But then, I’m the one who ended up doing that so many times.”

At this point, Cyrus tried to cut TJ off. “TJ, you didn’t-”

“But you gave me second chances, helped me change. I can’t ever thank you enough for that, Cyrus.”

For the first time since he started speaking, TJ looked Cyrus in the eyes. His eyes seemed watery as if he was going to cry any minute. Cyrus reached over, cupping his hand over TJ’s cheek. TJ leaned into the touch, almost nuzzling his hand.

“I love you so much, Cyrus. I need you to know that.”

“I love you too, TJ,” Cyrus replied, rubbing their noses together. “But why are you acting like this? You’re scaring me a bit.”

At this, TJ sat up, trying his best to avoid Cyrus’ eyes. Cyrus, too, sat up, now worried. “TJ?” he asked, concerned.

“I need to tell you something.”

Something about the way he said those words sent fear into Cyrus’ heart. He put his arms around TJ’s shoulders, holding him so that their faces were right in front of each other. “What happened?”

“I’m moving.”

Oh. Cyrus’ heart plummeted, and he loosened his grip over TJ’s shoulders. Tears began to prick at his eyes.

“You’re, what?”

“I’m sorry, Cyrus,” TJ whispered, his voice cracking.

“You can’t. You can’t be moving!”

“Hey,” TJ said, grabbing Cyrus’ hand, squeezing it. “It’ll be okay.”

“What if it isn’t, TJ? What if we don’t remain okay after some time?”

“We will be,” TJ said, tears now streaming down his face. “We have to be.”

He pulled Cyrus to him, their foreheads touching, their eyes closed. They savoured that moment, despair wrapping them in its icy hold.

“This isn’t the end, Cyrus. I will always love you. No matter what,” TJ said, his voice shaky but determined.

Cyrus looked TJ in the eye, tears now staining his cheeks. “And I will always love you.”

They leaned for a kiss, more desperate than before. Neither wanted to pull away, but eventually, they had to, gasping for air.

“When do you leave?” Cyrus asked, scared of the answer.

“In 4 days, after the basketball game is done.”

They didn’t have very long.

“Hey,” TJ whispered, holding up Cyrus’ chin. “We’ll be okay. You and me, we always find our way back to each other. We’ll do it again.”

Cyrus laughed weakly, holding onto TJ’s hand. “Yeah, we will.”

They stayed like that for what felt like an eternity, what felt like a few seconds. In the dying light of day, TJ whispered, “Don’t forget about me, okay?”

“Never.”

~~~~~~

I’m sorry.

“But you gave me second chances, helped me change. I can’t ever thank you enough for that, Cyrus.”

For the first time since he started speaking, TJ looked Cyrus in the eyes. His eyes seemed watery as if he was going to cry any minute. Cyrus reached over, cupping his hand over TJ’s cheek. TJ leaned into the touch, almost nuzzling his hand.

“I love you so much, Cyrus. I need you to know that.”

“I love you too, TJ,” Cyrus replied, rubbing their noses together. “But why are you acting like this? You’re scaring me a bit.”

At this, TJ sat up, trying his best to avoid Cyrus’ eyes. Cyrus, too, sat up, now worried. “TJ?” he asked, concerned.

“I need to tell you something.”

Something about the way he said those words sent fear into Cyrus’ heart. He put his arms around TJ’s shoulders, holding him so that their faces were right in front of each other. “What happened?”

“I’m moving.”

Oh. Cyrus’ heart plummeted, and he loosened his grip over TJ’s shoulders. Tears began to prick at his eyes.

“You’re, what?”

“I’m sorry, Cyrus,” TJ whispered, his voice cracking.

“You can’t. You can’t be moving!”

“Hey,” TJ said, grabbing Cyrus’ hand, squeezing it. “It’ll be okay.”

“What if it isn’t, TJ? What if we don’t remain okay after some time?”

“We will be,” TJ said, tears now streaming down his face. “We have to be.”

He pulled Cyrus to him, their foreheads touching, their eyes closed. They savoured that moment, despair wrapping them in its icy hold.

“This isn’t the end, Cyrus. I will always love you. No matter what,” TJ said, his voice shaky but determined.

Cyrus looked TJ in the eye, tears now staining his cheeks. “And I will always love you.”

They leaned for a kiss, more desperate than before. Neither wanted to pull away, but eventually, they had to, gasping for air.

“When do you leave?” Cyrus asked, scared of the answer.

“In 4 days, after the basketball game is done.”

They didn’t have very long.

“Hey,” TJ whispered, holding up Cyrus’ chin. “We’ll be okay. You and me, we always find our way back to each other. We’ll do it again.”

Cyrus laughed weakly, holding onto TJ’s hand. “Yeah, we will.”

They stayed like that for what felt like an eternity, what felt like a few seconds. In the dying light of day, TJ whispered, “Don’t forget about me, okay?”

“Never.”

~~~~~~

I’m sorry.

“You know I love you, right?”

Cyrus put down his book and looked up at TJ from where he lay on his lap. The sounds of children playing in the park floated through the air to where they were sitting under the tree. Well, TJ was sitting and Cyrus was lying down. The birds were chirping happily and the sunlight falling on TJ made his hair seem golden from his point of view.

“Oh, the many times you have told me since last week certainly didn’t make that clear.”

That response made TJ stop carding his fingers through Cyrus’ hair, settling for lightly pushing him.

“I’m serious, Underdog!”

“I know, Teej,” Cyrus said, sitting up properly. “I love you too.”

TJ’s face lit up in a soft smile, as he moved his hand down to the back of Cyrus’ neck, pulling him in for a soft kiss. Pulling apart, they just sat in silence for a while, their foreheads resting upon each other, their noses touching.

Cyrus moved away, much to TJ’s disappointment, and marked his place in his book. “How’s practice been these days?”

TJ sighed. “Fine. Everyone’s really worked up about the Finals day after. I’m trying to be encouraging, but I’m actually really worried.”

“Hey,” Cyrus said, putting his hand on TJ’s shoulder. “I’m sure you guys will win. I believe in you.”

TJ smiled back at Cyrus, worry still evident in his eyes. He covered Cyrus’ hand on his shoulder with his own, giving it a grateful squeeze. “Thank you, Cyrus.”

“Besides, I’ll be right there, cheering for you through it all!”

“Don’t know how much that would help,” TJ laughed.

“Wait, why?” Cyrus asked, concerned.

“You’re incredibly distracting!”

Cyrus pushed TJ away, feigning offence. “Oh, really? Fine, I won’t be there then!” he said, crossing his arms.

TJ just chuckled, pulling Cyrus close to him. “No, wait! I take it back. Please be there?” he asked, pouting.

Cyrus lasted all of 2 seconds with his act before he caved and smiled, snaking his arms around TJ’s neck. “Goddamn it, you can’t just put like that and expect me to be okay!”

“What can I say, Muffin? I only have one weapon in my arsenal when it comes to you,” TJ whispered, bumping their noses together, making Cyrus giggle. He pulled TJ in for another kiss.

“Okay, as fun as this is, I’m really hungry right now. What did you get?” TJ asked, pulling away to look in the basket Cyrus got with him. Basket, wow. His boyfriend was extra. And he loved it.

“Take a wild guess.”

“MUFFINS!” TJ said, practically yelling. He was so loud, some moms turned around in surprise.

He pulled out some packets from the basket, containing both chocolate chocolate chip and blueberry macadamia muffins. The latter made TJ hold them up in confusion.

“I thought you said these don’t exist?”

“Well, they do now. Thanks to my impeccable baking skills.”

“Oh god, wow. Cyrus. I knew that we have argued, but I never thought you would ever want to poison me.”

“Hey!” Cyrus said, smacking TJ on the head lightly. “I’ll have you know I am an excellent baker!”

“I’m kidding, Underdog. You could literally give me dirt and I’d eat it,” TJ said, taking a bite of the muffin. At first, he faked happiness until his expression morphed into one of genuine enjoyment.

“Whoa, Cyrus. Holy mother of- this is incredible!”

“Told you,” Cyrus said, pride thrilling through his heart. Well, pride at his baking and just love for the boy sitting next to him.

“Who knew you were a secret Rosanna Pansino?”

Cyrus shrugged, leaning back against the tree, taking another muffin offered to him by TJ.

Everything was peaceful.

*

A couple hours later, the two boys were lying down again, in opposite directions. Cyrus had resumed reading his book, and TJ was busy making daisy chains, even arranging some in Cyrus’ hair. They always had these comfortable silences, the ones where the two didn’t feel the need to speak. They just enjoyed the other’s presence, basking in the warmth that came.

“Hey.”

Cyrus turned to face TJ. He was upside down to Cyrus, but somehow he still managed to take his breath away. At that proximity, he was able to count all the freckles on TJ’s face if he wanted to.

“Hey.”

TJ reached out and stroked Cyrus’ cheek, pulling him in for a kiss. They pulled away, faces still close together. TJ whispered, “I’m so lucky to have met you.”

Cyrus opened his eyes to look at TJ. But for the first time that day, he saw TJ look hesitant.

TJ continued. “The first time I met you, that day in the cafeteria. I went there with the intent to just get Buffy to tutor me, but as soon as I saw you, something changed. Suddenly, I just wanted to help you with anything. I immediately decided that come what may, I won’t let anyone hurt you. I don’t even know why. We didn’t even know each other. But I wanted to get to know you.”

Cyrus stayed silent, curious to hear what TJ wanted to say.

“Then, when we talked at the swings for the first time, I couldn’t bother to put on my ‘mean guy’ mask around you. I just wanted to pour my heart to you. That was the first time I had felt completely free and happy in a long time. And it was thanks to you.”

Cyrus smiled fondly at the memory. He couldn’t have imagined back then what that one conversation would mean down the line.

“I didn’t want anyone to hurt you. But then, I’m the one who ended up doing that so many times.”

At this point, Cyrus tried to cut TJ off. “TJ, you didn’t-”

“But you gave me second chances, helped me change. I can’t ever thank you enough for that, Cyrus.”

For the first time since he started speaking, TJ looked Cyrus in the eyes. His eyes seemed watery as if he was going to cry any minute. Cyrus reached over, cupping his hand over TJ’s cheek. TJ leaned into the touch, almost nuzzling his hand.

“I love you so much, Cyrus. I need you to know that.”

“I love you too, TJ,” Cyrus replied, rubbing their noses together. “But why are you acting like this? You’re scaring me a bit.”

At this, TJ sat up, trying his best to avoid Cyrus’ eyes. Cyrus, too, sat up, now worried. “TJ?” he asked, concerned.

“I need to tell you something.”

Something about the way he said those words sent fear into Cyrus’ heart. He put his arms around TJ’s shoulders, holding him so that their faces were right in front of each other. “What happened?”

“I’m moving.”

Oh. Cyrus’ heart plummeted, and he loosened his grip over TJ’s shoulders. Tears began to prick at his eyes.

“You’re, what?”

“I’m sorry, Cyrus,” TJ whispered, his voice cracking.

“You can’t. You can’t be moving!”

“Hey,” TJ said, grabbing Cyrus’ hand, squeezing it. “It’ll be okay.”

“What if it isn’t, TJ? What if we don’t remain okay after some time?”

“We will be,” TJ said, tears now streaming down his face. “We have to be.”

He pulled Cyrus to him, their foreheads touching, their eyes closed. They savoured that moment, despair wrapping them in its icy hold.

“This isn’t the end, Cyrus. I will always love you. No matter what,” TJ said, his voice shaky but determined.

Cyrus looked TJ in the eye, tears now staining his cheeks. “And I will always love you.”

They leaned for a kiss, more desperate than before. Neither wanted to pull away, but eventually, they had to, gasping for air.

“When do you leave?” Cyrus asked, scared of the answer.

“In 4 days, after the basketball game is done.”

They didn’t have very long.

“Hey,” TJ whispered, holding up Cyrus’ chin. “We’ll be okay. You and me, we always find our way back to each other. We’ll do it again.”

Cyrus laughed weakly, holding onto TJ’s hand. “Yeah, we will.”

They stayed like that for what felt like an eternity, what felt like a few seconds. In the dying light of day, TJ whispered, “Don’t forget about me, okay?”

“Never.”
